href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/aa/COVID-19_Airport_Contact_Tracing.webm" title="Play media" target="new"><span class="play-btn-large"><span class="mw-tmh-playtext">Play media</span></span></a></div>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:COVID-19_Airport_Contact_Tracing.webm" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Mandatory traveller information collection for use in COVID-19 <a href="/wiki/Contact_tracing" title="Contact tracing">contact tracing</a> at New York City\'s <a href="/wiki/LaGuardia_Airport" title="LaGuardia Airport">LaGuardia Airport</a> in August 2020</div></div></div>\n<p><a href="/wiki/Contact_tracing" title="Contact tracing">Contact tracing</a> is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of infection and to prevent further transmission.<sup id="cite_ref-web_200-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-web-200">&#91;194&#93;</a></sup> The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with <a href="/wiki/Amnesty_International" title="Amnesty International">Amnesty International</a> and more than a hundred other organisations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.<sup id="cite_ref-IngramWard20200407_201-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IngramWard20200407-201">&#91;195&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p><a href="/wiki/COVID-19_apps" title="COVID-19 apps">Several mobile apps</a> have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of 7<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>April 2020 more than a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions such as using <a href="/wiki/Bluetooth" title="Bluetooth">Bluetooth</a> to log a user\'s proximity to other cellphones.<sup id="cite_ref-IngramWard20200407_201-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IngramWard20200407-201">&#91;195&#93;</a></sup> (Users are alerted if they have been near someone who subsequently tests positive.)<sup id="cite_ref-IngramWard20200407_201-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IngramWard20200407-201">&#91;195&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 10 April 2020, Google and <a href="/wiki/Apple_Inc." title="Apple Inc.">Apple</a> jointly announced an initiative for privacy-preserving contact tracing based on Bluetooth technology and <a href="/wiki/Cryptography" title="Cryptography">cryptography</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-0DF25_202-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-0DF25-202">&#91;196&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200410apple_203-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200410apple-203">&#91;197&#93;</a></sup> The system is intended to allow governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracking apps, with the eventual goal of integration of this functionality directly into the <a href="/wiki/IOS" title="IOS">iOS</a> and <a href="/wiki/Android_(operating_system)" title="Android (operating system)">Android</a> mobile platforms.<sup id="cite_ref-HQTFY_204-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HQTFY-204">&#91;198&#93;</a></sup> In Europe and in the U.S., <a href="/wiki/Palantir_Technologies" title="Palantir Technologies">Palantir Technologies</a> is also providing COVID-19 tracking services.<sup id="cite_ref-0k3hR_205-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-0k3hR-205">&#91;199&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Health_care">Health care</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Flattening_the_curve" title="Flattening the curve">Flattening the curve</a>, <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_hospital_beds" title="List of countries by hospital beds">list of countries by hospital beds</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Shortages_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Shortages related to the COVID-19 pandemic">Shortages related to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg/220px-%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg/330px-%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg/440px-%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4032" data-file-height="3024" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:%C3%96stra_Sjukhuset_COVID-19_F%C3%A4ltsjukhus.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>An army-constructed <a href="/wiki/Field_hospital" title="Field hospital">field hospital</a> outside <a href="/wiki/%C3%96stra_sjukhuset" class="mw-redirect" title="\xc3\x96stra sjukhuset">\xc3\x96stra sjukhuset</a> (<i>Eastern hospital</i>) in <a href="/wiki/Gothenburg" title="Gothenburg">Gothenburg</a>, Sweden, contains temporary <a href="/wiki/Intensive_care_unit" title="Intensive care unit">intensive care units</a> for COVID-19 patients.</div></div></div>\n<p>Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.<sup id="cite_ref-WHOEuropeResponse_206-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHOEuropeResponse-206">&#91;200&#93;</a></sup> The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and <a href="/wiki/Primary_health_care" title="Primary health care">primary healthcare services</a> for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing <a href="/wiki/Intensive_care_unit" title="Intensive care unit">intensive care</a> capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available <a href="/wiki/Ventilator" title="Ventilator">ventilators</a> and beds.<sup id="cite_ref-WHOEuropeResponse_206-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHOEuropeResponse-206">&#91;200&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ECDCresponse_207-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ECDCresponse-207">&#91;201&#93;</a></sup> In addition, in an attempt to maintain physical distancing, and to protect both patients and clinicians, in some areas non-emergency healthcare services are being provided virtually.<sup id="cite_ref-NMq5K_208-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NMq5K-208">&#91;202&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-E5ULQ_209-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-E5ULQ-209">&#91;203&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-6OxVw_210-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6OxVw-210">&#91;204&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>Due to capacity limitations in the standard <a href="/wiki/Supply_chain" title="Supply chain">supply chains</a>, some manufacturers are <a href="/wiki/3D_printing" title="3D printing">3D printing</a> healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.<sup id="cite_ref-technologyreview615420_211-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-technologyreview615420-211">&#91;205&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-aCPem_212-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-aCPem-212">&#91;206&#93;</a></sup> In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup received legal threats due to alleged patent infringement after reverse-engineering and printing the required hundred valves overnight.<sup id="cite_ref-PUkBW_213-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PUkBW-213">&#91;207&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-theverge21184308_214-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-theverge21184308-214">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-gE6ZQ_215-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gE6ZQ-215">&#91;209&#93;</a></sup> On 23 April 2020, <a href="/wiki/NASA" title="NASA">NASA</a> reported building, in 37 days, a ventilator which is currently undergoing further testing. NASA is seeking fast-track approval.<sup id="cite_ref-NASA-20200423_216-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NASA-20200423-216">&#91;210&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SPC-20200424_217-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SPC-20200424-217">&#91;211&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span></h2>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic">Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Pandemic_prevention" title="Pandemic prevention">Pandemic prevention</a> and <a href="/wiki/Pandemic_predictions_and_preparations_prior_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Pandemic predictions and preparations prior to the COVID-19 pandemic">Pandemic predictions and preparations prior to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2019">2019</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_2019" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2019">Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2019</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png" class="image"><img alt="An aerial view of the market, looking like a construction site." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png/220px-Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="130" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png/330px-Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png/440px-Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png 2x" data-file-width="1829" data-file-height="1080" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Huanan_Seafood_Wholesale_Market" title="Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market">Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market</a> in March 2020, after it was closed down</div></div></div>\n<div class="thumb tright" style="overflow:hidden;width:auto;max-width:100%"><div class="thumbinner"><div class="noresize" style="width:auto;overflow:auto;"><div style="white-space:nowrap">\n<div id="confirmed-covid-map-per-capita" style="">\n<div class="mw-graph mw-graph-always mw-graph-nofallback" style="min-width:500px;min-height:260px" data-graph-id="0f003f9ffb568f41a7b2b6ab4613d41d10f0b1a5"></div>\n</div></div></div><div class="thumbcaption"><div style="float:right"><a href="/wiki/Template:Interactive_COVID-19_maps" title="Template:Interactive COVID-19 maps"><img alt="Desc-i.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Desc-i.svg/16px-Desc-i.svg.png" decoding="async" width="16" height="16" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Desc-i.svg/24px-Desc-i.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/46/Desc-i.svg/32px-Desc-i.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="648" data-file-height="648" /></a></div>Interactive timeline map of confirmed cases per million people<br />(drag circle to adjust; may not work on mobile devices)</div></div></div>\n<p>Based on the retrospective analysis, starting from December 2019, the number of COVID-19 cases in Hubei gradually increased, reaching 60 by 20 December and at least 266 by 31 December.<sup id="cite_ref-original_report_218-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-original_report-218">&#91;212&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 24 December 2019, <a href="/wiki/Wuhan_Central_Hospital" class="mw-redirect" title="Wuhan Central Hospital">Wuhan Central Hospital</a> sent a <a href="/wiki/Bronchoalveolar_lavage_fluid" class="mw-redirect" title="Bronchoalveolar lavage fluid">bronchoalveolar lavage fluid</a> (BAL) sample from an unresolved clinical case to sequencing company Vision Medicals.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="citation needed for company used (February 2021)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> On 27 and 28 December, Vision Medicals informed the Wuhan Central Hospital and the Chinese CDC of the results of the test, showing a <a href="/wiki/Novel_coronavirus" title="Novel coronavirus">new coronavirus</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-caixintrace_219-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-caixintrace-219">&#91;213&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-220" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-220">&#91;214&#93;</a></sup> A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.<sup id="cite_ref-D54YB_221-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-D54YB-221">&#91;215&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 30 December 2019, a test report addressed to Wuhan Central Hospital, from company CapitalBio Medlab, stated that there was an erroneous positive result for <a href="/wiki/SARS" class="mw-redirect" title="SARS">SARS</a>, causing a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital to alert their colleagues and relevant hospital authorities of the result. Eight of those doctors, including <a href="/wiki/Li_Wenliang" title="Li Wenliang">Li Wenliang</a> (who was also punished on 3<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>January),<sup id="cite_ref-siStf_222-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-siStf-222">&#91;216&#93;</a></sup> were later admonished by the police for spreading false rumours; and another doctor, <a href="/wiki/Ai_Fen" title="Ai Fen">Ai Fen</a>, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.<sup id="cite_ref-20200311theguardian_223-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200311theguardian-223">&#91;217&#93;</a></sup> That evening, the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission issued a notice to various medical institutions about "the treatment of pneumonia of unknown cause".<sup id="cite_ref-promedmail6864153_224-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-promedmail6864153-224">&#91;218&#93;</a></sup> The next day, the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission made the first public announcement of a pneumonia outbreak of unknown cause, confirming 27 cases<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-69_225-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-69-225">&#91;219&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-PYMIR_226-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PYMIR-226">&#91;220&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-68_227-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-68-227">&#91;221&#93;</a></sup>\xe2\x80\x94enough to trigger an investigation.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc50984025_228-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc50984025-228">&#91;222&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The following day, on December 31, the WHO learned about a <a href="/wiki/Disease_cluster" title="Disease cluster">cluster</a> of viral pneumonia cases of an unknown cause in Wuhan.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-69_225-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-69-225">&#91;219&#93;</a></sup> An investigation was launched at the start of January 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc50984025_228-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc50984025-228">&#91;222&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>According to official Chinese sources, the early cases were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals.<sup id="cite_ref-characteristicsZH_229-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-characteristicsZH-229">&#91;223&#93;</a></sup> However, in May 2020, <a href="/wiki/George_F._Gao" title="George F. Gao">George Gao</a>, the director of the <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Center_for_Disease_Control_and_Prevention" title="Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention">Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention</a>, said animal samples collected from the seafood market had tested negative for the virus, indicating the market was not the source of the initial outbreak.<sup id="cite_ref-ALmAQ_230-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ALmAQ-230">&#91;224&#93;</a></sup> In March 2021, the WHO published their report on the potential zoonotic source of the virus. The WHO concluded that human spillover via an intermediate animal host was the most likely explanation, with direct spillover from bats next most likely and introduction through the food supply chain as another possible explanation.<sup id="cite_ref-231" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-231">&#91;225&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-:5_18-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:5-18">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2020">2020</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Timelines of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 by month: <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_January_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in January 2020">January</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_February_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in February 2020">February</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_March_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in March 2020">March</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_April_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in April 2020">April</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_May_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in May 2020">May</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_June_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in June 2020">June</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_July_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in July 2020">July</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_August_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in August 2020">August</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_September_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in September 2020">September</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_October_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in October 2020">October</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_November_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in November 2020">November</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_December_2020" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in December 2020">December</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:192px;"><a href="/wiki/File:2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg/190px-2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="253" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg/285px-2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/51/2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg/380px-2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3024" data-file-height="4032" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:2020-3-20_%E9%BB%84%E5%86%88%E9%80%81%E5%88%AB%E5%B1%B1%E4%B8%9C%E6%8F%B4%E9%84%82%E5%8C%BB%E7%96%97%E9%98%9F_%E9%BB%84%E6%A2%85%E6%88%8F%E5%A4%A7%E5%89%A7%E9%99%A2.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Chinese medics in the city of <a href="/wiki/Huanggang" title="Huanggang">Huanggang</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hubei" title="Hubei">Hubei</a> on 20 March 2020</div></div></div>\n<p>During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.<sup id="cite_ref-Qun29Jan2020_232-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Qun29Jan2020-232">&#91;226&#93;</a></sup> In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other <a href="/wiki/Provinces_of_China" title="Provinces of China">Chinese provinces</a>, helped by the <a href="/wiki/Chunyun" title="Chunyun">Chinese New Year migration</a> and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.<sup id="cite_ref-WHO_report_28_February_2020_233-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHO_report_28_February_2020-233">&#91;227&#93;</a></sup> On 10 January, the SARS-CoV-2 genetic sequence data was shared through <a href="/wiki/GISAID" title="GISAID">GISAID</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234">&#91;228&#93;</a></sup> On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in <a href="/wiki/Shenzhen" title="Shenzhen">Shenzhen</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-france2420200120_235-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-france2420200120-235">&#91;229&#93;</a></sup> A retrospective official study published in March found that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January (most of them would be diagnosed later)<sup id="cite_ref-Epidemiology17Feb2020_236-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epidemiology17Feb2020-236">&#91;230&#93;</a></sup> and more may have been infected.<sup id="cite_ref-flattery_237-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-flattery-237">&#91;231&#93;</a></sup> A report in <i><a href="/wiki/The_Lancet" title="The Lancet">The Lancet</a></i> on 24 January indicated human transmission, strongly recommended <a href="/wiki/Personal_protective_equipment" title="Personal protective equipment">personal protective equipment</a> for health workers, and said testing for the virus was essential due to its "pandemic potential".<sup id="cite_ref-Huang24Jan2020_34-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Huang24Jan2020-34">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Horton_18_March_238-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Horton_18_March-238">&#91;232&#93;</a></sup> On 31 January <i>The Lancet</i> would publish the first modelling study explicitly warning of inevitable "independent self-sustaining outbreaks in major cities globally" and calling for "large-scale public health interventions."<sup id="cite_ref-pmid32014114_239-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pmid32014114-239">&#91;233&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 30 January 2020, with 7,818 confirmed cases across 19 countries, the WHO declared the COVID-19 outbreak a <a href="/wiki/Public_Health_Emergency_of_International_Concern" title="Public Health Emergency of International Concern">Public Health Emergency of International Concern</a> (PHEIC),<sup id="cite_ref-WHO_PHEICSR_240-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHO_PHEICSR-240">&#91;234&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-WHO_PHEIC_decl2_241-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHO_PHEIC_decl2-241">&#91;235&#93;</a></sup> and then a <a href="/wiki/Pandemic" title="Pandemic">pandemic</a> on 11 March 2020<sup id="cite_ref-WHO_pandemicSR_242-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHO_pandemicSR-242">&#91;236&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-WHOpandemic_243-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHOpandemic-243">&#91;237&#93;</a></sup> as Italy, Iran, South Korea, and Japan reported increasing numbers of cases.\n</p><p>On 31 January 2020, Italy had its first confirmed cases, two tourists from China.<sup id="cite_ref-Corriere_20Jan_244-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Corriere_20Jan-244">&#91;238&#93;</a></sup> As of 13 March 2020, the WHO considered Europe the active centre of the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-nypost20200313_245-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nypost20200313-245">&#91;239&#93;</a></sup> On 19 March 2020, Italy overtook China as the country with the most reported deaths.<sup id="cite_ref-sky11960412_246-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-sky11960412-246">&#91;240&#93;</a></sup> By 26 March, the United States had overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-NYT-20200326_247-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NYT-20200326-247">&#91;241&#93;</a></sup> Research on SARS-CoV-2 genomes indicates the majority of COVID-19 cases in <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_New_York_(state)" title="COVID-19 pandemic in New York (state)">New York</a> came from European travelers, rather than directly from China or any other Asian country.<sup id="cite_ref-20200408nytimes_248-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200408nytimes-248">&#91;242&#93;</a></sup> Retesting of prior samples found a person in France who had the virus on 27 December 2019<sup id="cite_ref-France-retest_249-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-France-retest-249">&#91;243&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Deslandes_2020_250-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Deslandes_2020-250">&#91;244&#93;</a></sup> and a person in the United States who died from the disease on 6<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>February 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-PBS-2wks_251-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PBS-2wks-251">&#91;245&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 11 June 2020, after 55 days without a locally transmitted case being officially reported,<sup id="cite_ref-scmp-markets_252-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-scmp-markets-252">&#91;246&#93;</a></sup> the city of Beijing reported a single COVID-19 case, followed by two more cases on 12 June.<sup id="cite_ref-Vlsb1_253-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Vlsb1-253">&#91;247&#93;</a></sup> As of 15 June 2020, 79 cases were officially confirmed.<sup id="cite_ref-wAsR1_254-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wAsR1-254">&#91;248&#93;</a></sup> Most of these patients went to <a href="/wiki/Xinfadi_Market" title="Xinfadi Market">Xinfadi Wholesale Market</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-scmp-markets_252-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-scmp-markets-252">&#91;246&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-oOS1t_255-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-oOS1t-255">&#91;249&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 29 June 2020, WHO warned that the spread of the virus was still accelerating as countries reopened their economies, despite many countries having made progress in slowing down the spread.<sup id="cite_ref-HfGjG_256-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HfGjG-256">&#91;250&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 15 July 2020, one COVID-19 case was officially reported in <a href="/wiki/Dalian" title="Dalian">Dalian</a> in more than three months. The patient did not travel outside the city in the 14 days before developing symptoms, nor did he have contact with people from "areas of attention."<sup id="cite_ref-undercurrent_257-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-undercurrent-257">&#91;251&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>In October 2020, the WHO stated, at a special meeting of WHO leaders, that one in ten people around the world may have been infected with COVID-19. At the time, that translated to 780&#160;million people being infected, while only 35&#160;million infections had been confirmed.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc_oneinten_258-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc_oneinten-258">&#91;252&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>In early November 2020, Denmark reported on <a href="/wiki/Cluster_5" title="Cluster 5">an outbreak of a unique mutated variant</a> being transmitted to humans from <a href="/wiki/Minks" class="mw-redirect" title="Minks">minks</a> in its <a href="/wiki/North_Jutland_Region" title="North Jutland Region">North Jutland Region</a>. All twelve human cases of the mutated variant were identified in September 2020. The WHO released a report saying the variant "had a combination of mutations or changes that have not been previously observed."<sup id="cite_ref-5qH0Q_259-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5qH0Q-259">&#91;253&#93;</a></sup> In response, Prime Minister <a href="/wiki/Mette_Frederiksen" title="Mette Frederiksen">Mette Frederiksen</a> ordered for the country \xe2\x80\x93 the world\'s largest producer of mink fur \xe2\x80\x93 to cull its mink population by as many as 17&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-y6eQ0_260-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-y6eQ0-260">&#91;254&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 9 November 2020, <a href="/wiki/Pfizer" title="Pfizer">Pfizer</a> released their trial results for a candidate vaccine, showing that it is 90% effective against the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-FEv4C_261-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FEv4C-261">&#91;255&#93;</a></sup> Later that day, <a href="/wiki/Novavax" title="Novavax">Novavax</a> entered an <a href="/wiki/Food_and_Drug_Administration" title="Food and Drug Administration">FDA</a> Fast Track application for their vaccine.<sup id="cite_ref-NPZ5P_262-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NPZ5P-262">&#91;256&#93;</a></sup>  Virologist and U.S. <a href="/wiki/National_Institute_of_Allergy_and_Infectious_Diseases" title="National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases">National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases</a> director <a href="/wiki/Anthony_Fauci" title="Anthony Fauci">Anthony Fauci</a> indicated that the Pfizer vaccine targets the spike protein used to infect cells by the virus. Some issues left to be answered are how long the vaccine offers protection, and if it offers the same level of protection to all ages. Initial doses will likely go to healthcare workers on the front lines.<sup id="cite_ref-qAMCq_263-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-qAMCq-263">&#91;257&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 9 November 2020 the United States surpassed 10&#160;million confirmed cases of COVID-19, making it the country with the most cases worldwide by a large margin.<sup id="cite_ref-JCmUy_264-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JCmUy-264">&#91;258&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>It was reported on 27 November, that a publication released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention indicated that the current numbers of viral infection are via confirmed laboratory test only. However, the true number could be about eight times the reported number; the report further indicated that the true number of virus infected cases <i>could be</i> around 100&#160;million in the U.S.<sup id="cite_ref-265" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-265">&#91;259&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-266" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-266">&#91;260&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 14 December 2020, <a href="/wiki/Public_Health_England" title="Public Health England">Public Health England</a> reported a new variant had been discovered in the South East of England, predominantly in <a href="/wiki/Kent" title="Kent">Kent</a>. The variant, named <a href="/wiki/Variant_of_Concern_202012/01" class="mw-redirect" title="Variant of Concern 202012/01">Variant of Concern 202012/01</a>, showed changes to the <a href="/wiki/Peplomer" title="Peplomer">spike protein</a> which could make the virus more infectious. As of 13 December, there were 1,108 cases identified.<sup id="cite_ref-267" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-267">&#91;261&#93;</a></sup> Many countries halted all flights from the UK;<sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-268">&#91;262&#93;</a></sup> France-bound <a href="/wiki/Eurotunnel" class="mw-redirect" title="Eurotunnel">Eurotunnel</a> service was suspended and ferries carrying passengers and accompanied freight were cancelled as the French border closed to people on 20 December.<sup id="cite_ref-France_shuts_border_269-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-France_shuts_border-269">&#91;263&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2021">2021</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Timelines of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2021 by month: <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_January_2021" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in January 2021">January</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_February_2021" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in February 2021">February</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_March_2021" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in March 2021">March</a>, <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_in_April_2021" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in April 2021">April</a></div>\n<p>On 2 January, VOC-202012/01, a variant of SARS-CoV-2 first discovered in the UK, had been identified in 33 countries around the world, including Pakistan, South Korea, Switzerland, Taiwan, Norway, Italy, Japan, Lebanon, India, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Iceland, and China.<sup id="cite_ref-270" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-270">&#91;264&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 6 January, the <a href="/wiki/Lineage_P.1" title="Lineage P.1">P.1 variant</a> was first identified in Japanese travelers who had just returned from Brazil.<sup id="cite_ref-271" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-271">&#91;265&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 12 January, it was reported that a team of scientists from the World Health Organization would arrive in Wuhan on the 14th of the month; this is to ascertain the origin of SARS-CoV-2 and determine what were the intermediate hosts between the original reservoir and humans.<sup id="cite_ref-272" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-272">&#91;266&#93;</a></sup> On the following day, two of the WHO members were barred from entering China because, according to the country, antibodies for the virus were detected in both.<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-273">&#91;267&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 29 January, it was reported that the Novavax vaccine was only 49% effective against the 501.V2 variant in a clinical trial in South Africa.<sup id="cite_ref-274" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-274">&#91;268&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-275" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-275">&#91;269&#93;</a></sup> The China COVID-19 vaccine CoronaVac indicated 50.4% effectivity in a Brazil clinical trial.<sup id="cite_ref-276" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-276">&#91;270&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 12 March, it was reported that several countries including Thailand, Denmark, Bulgaria, Norway, and Iceland had stopped using the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine due to what was being called severe blood clotting problems, a <a href="/wiki/Cerebral_venous_sinus_thrombosis" title="Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis">cerebral venous sinus thrombosis (CVST)</a>. Additionally, Austria halted the use of one batch of the aforementioned vaccine as well.<sup id="cite_ref-277" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-277">&#91;271&#93;</a></sup> On 20 March, the WHO and European Medicines Agency found no link between <a href="/wiki/Thrombus" title="Thrombus">thrombus</a> (a blood clot of clinical importance), leading several European countries to resume administering the AstraZeneca vaccine.<sup id="cite_ref-278" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-278">&#91;272&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 29 March, it was reported that the U.S. government was planning to introduce <a href="/wiki/Use_and_development_of_software_for_COVID-19_pandemic_mitigation#Digital_vaccination_passport" title="Use and development of software for COVID-19 pandemic mitigation">COVID-19 vaccination \'passports\'</a> to allow those who have been vaccinated the ability to board airplanes, cruise ships as well as other activities.<sup id="cite_ref-279" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-279">&#91;273&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>As of 6 May 2021, more than 155<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>million cases have been reported worldwide due to COVID-19; more than 3.24<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>million have died and more than 91.8<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>million have recovered.<sup id="cite_ref-JHU_ticker_4-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JHU_ticker-4">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="National_responses">National responses</span></h2>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_lockdowns" title="COVID-19 lockdowns">COVID-19 lockdowns</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_by_country_and_territory" title="COVID-19 pandemic by country and territory">COVID-19 pandemic by country and territory</a>, and <a href="/wiki/National_responses_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="National responses to the COVID-19 pandemic">National responses to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_(49627907646).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_%2849627907646%29.jpg/220px-President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_%2849627907646%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_%2849627907646%29.jpg/330px-President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_%2849627907646%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/44/President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_%2849627907646%29.jpg/440px-President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_%2849627907646%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3000" data-file-height="2000" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:President_Trump_Signs_the_Congressional_Funding_Bill_for_Coronavirus_Response_(49627907646).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Then-US President <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a> signs the <a href="/wiki/Coronavirus_Preparedness_and_Response_Supplemental_Appropriations_Act,_2020" title="Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2020">Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act</a> into law with <a href="/wiki/Alex_Azar" title="Alex Azar">Alex Azar</a> on 6<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>March 2020.</div></div></div>\n<p>A total of 192<sup id="cite_ref-JHU_ticker_4-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JHU_ticker-4">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup> countries and territories have had at least one case of COVID-19 so far. Due to the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Europe" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Europe">pandemic in Europe</a>, many countries in the <a href="/wiki/Schengen_Area" title="Schengen Area">Schengen Area</a> have restricted free movement and set up border controls.<sup id="cite_ref-iR2Oj_280-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iR2Oj-280">&#91;274&#93;</a></sup> National reactions have included containment measures such as <a href="/wiki/Curfews_and_lockdowns_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" class="mw-redirect" title="Curfews and lockdowns related to the COVID-19 pandemic">quarantines and curfews</a> (known as <a href="/wiki/Stay-at-home_orders" class="mw-redirect" title="Stay-at-home orders">stay-at-home orders</a>, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdowns).<sup id="cite_ref-IVdfl_281-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IVdfl-281">&#91;275&#93;</a></sup> The WHO\'s recommendation on curfews and lockdowns is that they should be short-term measures to reorganise, regroup, rebalance resources, and protect health workers who are exhausted. To achieve a balance between restrictions and normal life, the long-term responses to the pandemic should consist of strict personal hygiene, effective contact tracing, and isolating when ill.<sup id="cite_ref-58tIM_282-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-58tIM-282">&#91;276&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>By 26 March 2020, 1.7&#160;billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown,<sup id="cite_ref-theguardian500000_283-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-theguardian500000-283">&#91;277&#93;</a></sup> which increased to 3.9&#160;billion people by the first week of April\xe2\x80\x94more than half the <a href="/wiki/World_population" title="World population">world\'s population</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-20200403euronews_284-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200403euronews-284">&#91;278&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200328businessinsider_285-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200328businessinsider-285">&#91;279&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>By late April 2020, around 300&#160;million people were under lockdown in nations of Europe, including but not limited to <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Italy" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Italy">Italy</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Spain">Spain</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_France" title="COVID-19 pandemic in France">France</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>, while around 200&#160;million people were under lockdown in Latin America.<sup id="cite_ref-end_april_286-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-end_april-286">&#91;280&#93;</a></sup> Nearly 300&#160;million people, or about 90 percent of the population, were under some form of lockdown in the United States,<sup id="cite_ref-20200402businessinsider_287-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200402businessinsider-287">&#91;281&#93;</a></sup> around 100&#160;million people in the Philippines,<sup id="cite_ref-end_april_286-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-end_april-286">&#91;280&#93;</a></sup> about 59&#160;million people in <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_South_Africa" title="COVID-19 pandemic in South Africa">South Africa</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-20200327nytimes_288-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200327nytimes-288">&#91;282&#93;</a></sup> and 1.3&#160;billion people have been under <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_lockdown_in_India" title="COVID-19 lockdown in India">lockdown in India</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-20200329theguardian_289-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200329theguardian-289">&#91;283&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-aljazeera2003270945_290-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-aljazeera2003270945-290">&#91;284&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Asia">Asia</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Asia" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Asia">COVID-19 pandemic in Asia</a></div>\n<p>As of 30&#160;April&#160;2020,<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Tajik1st_291-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Tajik1st-291">&#91;285&#93;</a></sup> cases have been reported in all Asian countries except for <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Turkmenistan" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Turkmenistan">Turkmenistan</a> and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_North_Korea" title="COVID-19 pandemic in North Korea">North Korea</a>, although these countries likely also have cases.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc52186521_292-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc52186521-292">&#91;286&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-bbc52146989_293-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc52146989-293">&#91;287&#93;</a></sup> Despite being the first area of the world hit by the outbreak, the early wide-scale response of some Asian states, particularly <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Bhutan" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Bhutan">Bhutan</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-294">&#91;288&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Singapore" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Singapore">Singapore</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-295" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-295">&#91;289&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Taiwan" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Taiwan">Taiwan</a><sup id="cite_ref-Nation_Taiwan_296-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Nation_Taiwan-296">&#91;290&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Vietnam" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Vietnam">Vietnam</a><sup id="cite_ref-7news973119_297-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7news973119-297">&#91;291&#93;</a></sup> has allowed them to fare comparatively well. <a href="/wiki/China" title="China">China</a> was criticised for initially minimising the severity of the outbreak, but its wide-scale response has largely contained the disease since March 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_298-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-298">&#91;292&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-299" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-299">&#91;293&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-300" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300">&#91;294&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-301" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-301">&#91;295&#93;</a></sup> As of 29 January 2021, Singapore has the lowest case fatality rate in the world at &lt;0.1%.<sup id="cite_ref-JHUM_302-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JHUM-302">&#91;296&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The pandemic has had direct side effects, per a report on 28 November, in <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Japan" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Japan">Japan</a>. According to the report by the country\'s <a href="/wiki/National_Police_Agency_(Japan)" title="National Police Agency (Japan)">National Police Agency</a>, suicides had increased to 2,153 in October. Experts also state that the pandemic has worsened mental health issues due to lockdowns and isolation from family members, among other issues.<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">&#91;297&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="China">China</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_mainland_China" title="COVID-19 pandemic in mainland China">COVID-19 pandemic in mainland China</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg/220px-%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg/330px-%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg/440px-%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4032" data-file-height="3024" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:%E5%A1%94%E5%AD%90%E6%B9%96%E4%BD%93%E8%82%B2%E4%B8%AD%E5%BF%83%E6%94%B9%E9%80%A0%E7%9A%84%E6%96%B9%E8%88%B1%E5%8C%BB%E9%99%A2_07.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A <a href="/wiki/Fangcang_Hospital" class="mw-redirect" title="Fangcang Hospital">temporary hospital</a> constructed in <a href="/wiki/Wuhan" title="Wuhan">Wuhan</a> in February 2020</div></div></div>\n<p>As of 14 July 2020, there are 83,545 cases confirmed in China\xe2\x80\x94 excluding 114 asymptomatic cases, 62 of which were imported, under medical observation; asymptomatic cases have not been reported prior to 31 March 2020\xe2\x80\x94with 4,634 deaths and 78,509 recoveries,<sup id="cite_ref-llOna_304-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-llOna-304">&#91;298&#93;</a></sup> meaning there are only 402 cases. Hubei has the most cases, followed by <a href="/wiki/Xinjiang" title="Xinjiang">Xinjiang</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-xS8Ev_305-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-xS8Ev-305">&#91;299&#93;</a></sup> By March 2020, COVID-19 infections have largely been put under control in China,<sup id="cite_ref-:0_298-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-298">&#91;292&#93;</a></sup> with minor outbreaks since.<sup id="cite_ref-306" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-306">&#91;300&#93;</a></sup> It was reported on 25 November, that some 1&#160;million people in the country of China have been vaccinated according to China\'s state council; the vaccines against COVID-19 come from Sinopharm which makes two and one produced by Sinovac.<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">&#91;301&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="India">India</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_India" title="COVID-19 pandemic in India">COVID-19 pandemic in India</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:212px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg/210px-Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg" decoding="async" width="210" height="191" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg/315px-Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg/420px-Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg 2x" data-file-width="959" data-file-height="871" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Thermal_Screening_of_Sebayats.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Indian officials conducting temperature checks at the <a href="/wiki/Ratha_Yatra" title="Ratha Yatra">Ratha Yatra</a> Hindu festival on 23 June 2020</div></div></div>\n<p>The first case of COVID-19 in India was reported on 30 January 2020. India ordered a nationwide lockdown for the entire population starting 24 March 2020,<sup id="cite_ref-mrGsK_308-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mrGsK-308">&#91;302&#93;</a></sup> with a phased unlock beginning 1 June 2020. Six cities account for around half of all reported cases in the country\xe2\x80\x94<a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Maharashtra" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Maharashtra">Mumbai</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Delhi" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Delhi">Delhi</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Gujarat" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Gujarat">Ahmedabad</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Tamil_Nadu" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Tamil Nadu">Chennai</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Maharashtra" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Maharashtra">Pune</a> and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_West_Bengal" title="COVID-19 pandemic in West Bengal">Kolkata</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-sHMHJ_309-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-sHMHJ-309">&#91;303&#93;</a></sup> On 10 June 2020, India\'s recoveries exceeded active cases for the first time.<sup id="cite_ref-P0IqK_310-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-P0IqK-310">&#91;304&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 30 August 2020, India surpassed the US record for the most cases in a single day, with more than 78,000 cases,<sup id="cite_ref-2it1s_311-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2it1s-311">&#91;305&#93;</a></sup> and set a new record on 16 September 2020, with almost 98,000 cases reported that day.<sup id="cite_ref-312" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-312">&#91;306&#93;</a></sup> As of 30 August 2020, India\'s case fatality rate is relatively low at 2.3%, against the global 4.7%.<sup id="cite_ref-SYon7_313-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SYon7-313">&#91;307&#93;</a></sup><sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Dates_and_numbers#Chronological_items" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Dates and numbers"><span title="The date of the event predicted near this tag has passed. (February 2021)">needs update</span></a></i>&#93;</sup>\n</p><p>As of September 2020, India had the largest number of <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Asia" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Asia">confirmed cases in Asia</a>;<sup id="cite_ref-asia_first_314-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-asia_first-314">&#91;308&#93;</a></sup> and the second-highest number of confirmed cases in the world,<sup id="cite_ref-E8R37_315-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-E8R37-315">&#91;309&#93;</a></sup> behind the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States" title="COVID-19 pandemic in the United States">United States</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-5yBLb_316-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5yBLb-316">&#91;310&#93;</a></sup> with the number of total confirmed cases breaching the 100,000 mark on 19 May 2020,<sup id="cite_ref-2ACPr_317-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2ACPr-317">&#91;311&#93;</a></sup> 1,000,000 on 16 July 2020,<sup id="cite_ref-dT4iD_318-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dT4iD-318">&#91;312&#93;</a></sup> and 5,000,000 confirmed cases on 16 September 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-btBce_319-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-btBce-319">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 19 December 2020, India crossed the total number of 10,000,000 confirmed cases but with a slow pace.<sup id="cite_ref-320" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-320">&#91;314&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The Indian Ministry of Science initiated a mathematical simulation of the pandemic, the so-called "Indian Supermodel", which correctly predicted the decrease of active cases starting in September 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-321" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-321">&#91;315&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-:2_12-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:2-12">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-322" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-322">&#91;316&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-323">&#91;317&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-324" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-324">&#91;318&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>A second wave hit India in April 2021, placing healthcare services under severe strain.<sup id="cite_ref-325" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-325">&#91;319&#93;</a></sup> By late April, the government was reporting over 300,000 new infections and 2,000 deaths per day, with concerns of undercounting.<sup id="cite_ref-326" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-326">&#91;320&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Iran">Iran</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Iran" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Iran">COVID-19 pandemic in Iran</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg/220px-Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="133" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg/330px-Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/52/Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg/440px-Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1050" data-file-height="635" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Disinfection_of_Tehran_subway_wagons_against_coronavirus_2020-02-26_09.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Disinfection of <a href="/wiki/Tehran_Metro" title="Tehran Metro">Tehran Metro</a> trains against COVID-19 transmission. Similar measures have also been taken in other countries.<sup id="cite_ref-2kQpo_327-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2kQpo-327">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>\n<p>Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February 2020 in <a href="/wiki/Qom" title="Qom">Qom</a>, where, according to the <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_and_Medical_Education" title="Ministry of Health and Medical Education">Ministry of Health and Medical Education</a>, two people had died that day.<sup id="cite_ref-wHBRB_328-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wHBRB-328">&#91;322&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4yrqM_329-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4yrqM-329">&#91;323&#93;</a></sup> Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events,<sup id="cite_ref-Xm5nq_330-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Xm5nq-330">&#91;324&#93;</a></sup> sporting events,<sup id="cite_ref-aEO6O_331-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-aEO6O-331">&#91;325&#93;</a></sup> Friday prayers,<sup id="cite_ref-Urdn6_332-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Urdn6-332">&#91;326&#93;</a></sup> and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.<sup id="cite_ref-2YX6a_333-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2YX6a-333">&#91;327&#93;</a></sup> Iran allocated 5<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>trillion <a href="/wiki/Iranian_rial" title="Iranian rial">rials</a> (equivalent to <span style="white-space: nowrap">US$120,000,000</span>) to combat the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-grT4c_334-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-grT4c-334">&#91;328&#93;</a></sup> President <a href="/wiki/Hassan_Rouhani" title="Hassan Rouhani">Hassan Rouhani</a> said on 26 February 2020 there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.<sup id="cite_ref-BEhed_335-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BEhed-335">&#91;329&#93;</a></sup> Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March 2020,<sup id="cite_ref-BBqei_336-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBqei-336">&#91;330&#93;</a></sup> although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year <a href="/wiki/Nowruz" title="Nowruz">Nowruz</a> continued.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc24032020_337-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc24032020-337">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Shia" class="mw-redirect" title="Shia">Shia</a> shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March.<sup id="cite_ref-HhmZ1_338-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HhmZ1-338">&#91;332&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-iran_shrines_339-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iran_shrines-339">&#91;333&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China in February 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-HHOnl_340-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HHOnl-340">&#91;334&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-newyorker_341-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-newyorker-341">&#91;335&#93;</a></sup> More than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating the outbreak may have been more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.<sup id="cite_ref-newyorker_341-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-newyorker-341">&#91;335&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-D2Xpc_342-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-D2Xpc-342">&#91;336&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Islamic_Consultative_Assembly" title="Islamic Consultative Assembly">Iranian Parliament</a> was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>March 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-fXv2K_343-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fXv2K-343">&#91;337&#93;</a></sup> On 15 March 2020, the Iranian government reported a hundred deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.<sup id="cite_ref-omeCS_344-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-omeCS-344">&#91;338&#93;</a></sup> At least twelve sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-oxtUC_345-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-oxtUC-345">&#91;339&#93;</a></sup> By 23 March 2020, Iran was experiencing fifty new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to COVID-19.<sup id="cite_ref-V0Gmj_346-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-V0Gmj-346">&#91;340&#93;</a></sup> According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported. It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country\'s financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.<sup id="cite_ref-9upke_347-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9upke-347">&#91;341&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 20 April 2020, Iran reopened shopping malls and other shopping areas across the country.<sup id="cite_ref-yahoo080329918_348-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-yahoo080329918-348">&#91;342&#93;</a></sup> After reaching a low in new cases in early May, a new peak was reported on 4<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>June 2020, raising fear of a second wave.<sup id="cite_ref-ibeNh_349-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ibeNh-349">&#91;343&#93;</a></sup> On 18 July 2020, President Rouhani estimated that 25&#160;million Iranians had already become infected, which is considerably higher than the official count.<sup id="cite_ref-reuters_july2020_350-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-reuters_july2020-350">&#91;344&#93;</a></sup> Leaked data suggest that 42,000 people had died with COVID-19 symptoms by 20 July 2020, nearly tripling the 14,405 officially reported by that date.<sup id="cite_ref-QtjEU_351-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-QtjEU-351">&#91;345&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="South_Korea">South Korea</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_South_Korea" title="COVID-19 pandemic in South Korea">COVID-19 pandemic in South Korea</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg/220px-Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg/330px-Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg/440px-Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2400" data-file-height="1597" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Coronavirus_Check_by_Drive-Through.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A <a href="/wiki/Drive-through" title="Drive-through">drive-through</a> test centre at the <a href="/wiki/Gyeongju" title="Gyeongju">Gyeongju</a> Public Health Centre</div></div></div>\n<p>COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China. The nation\'s health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February,<sup id="cite_ref-ThomReut_SKorea_zombie_352-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ThomReut_SKorea_zombie-352">&#91;346&#93;</a></sup> largely attributed to a gathering in <a href="/wiki/Daegu" title="Daegu">Daegu</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Shincheonji_Church_of_Jesus_the_Temple_of_the_Tabernacle_of_the_Testimony" class="mw-redirect" title="Shincheonji Church of Jesus the Temple of the Tabernacle of the Testimony">Shincheonji Church of Jesus</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-ThomReut_SKorea_zombie_352-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ThomReut_SKorea_zombie-352">&#91;346&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-zMJnB_353-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-zMJnB-353">&#91;347&#93;</a></sup> Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.<sup id="cite_ref-b82186_354-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-b82186-354">&#91;348&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-koreabiomed_355-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-koreabiomed-355">&#91;349&#93;</a></sup> By 22 February<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13 percent reported symptoms.<sup id="cite_ref-BOQ2O_356-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BOQ2O-356">&#91;350&#93;</a></sup> South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-GKvzB_357-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GKvzB-357">&#91;351&#93;</a></sup> On 29 February, more than 3,150 confirmed cases were reported.<sup id="cite_ref-SPmG7_358-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SPmG7-358">&#91;352&#93;</a></sup> All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests showed three soldiers had the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-b82186_354-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-b82186-354">&#91;348&#93;</a></sup> Airline schedules were also changed.<sup id="cite_ref-l2hq3_359-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-l2hq3-359">&#91;353&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-iLVLj_360-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iLVLj-360">&#91;354&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organised programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, isolate any infected people, and trace and quarantine those who contacted them.<sup id="cite_ref-science20200317_361-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-science20200317-361">&#91;355&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-mNKf7_362-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mNKf7-362">&#91;356&#93;</a></sup> Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application,<sup id="cite_ref-nbcnews1167376_363-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nbcnews1167376-363">&#91;357&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Drive-through" title="Drive-through">drive-through</a> testing for the virus with the results available the next day,<sup id="cite_ref-CvyZS_364-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CvyZS-364">&#91;358&#93;</a></sup> and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.<sup id="cite_ref-fdhQW_365-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fdhQW-365">&#91;359&#93;</a></sup> Despite some early criticisms of President <a href="/wiki/Moon_Jae-in" title="Moon Jae-in">Moon Jae-in</a>\'s response to the crisis,<sup id="cite_ref-imx38_366-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-imx38-366">&#91;360&#93;</a></sup> South Korea\'s programme is considered a success in controlling the outbreak without quarantining entire cities.<sup id="cite_ref-science20200317_361-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-science20200317-361">&#91;355&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Wypis_367-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Wypis-367">&#91;361&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-joins23778577_368-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-joins23778577-368">&#91;362&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-fdhQW_365-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fdhQW-365">&#91;359&#93;</a></sup> On 29 March, it was reported that beginning 1<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-yahoo013830705_369-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-yahoo013830705-369">&#91;363&#93;</a></sup> Per media reports on 1<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.<sup id="cite_ref-U0Hrf_370-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-U0Hrf-370">&#91;364&#93;</a></sup> Persistent local groups of infections in the greater Seoul area continued to be found, which led to Korea\'s CDC director saying in June that the country had entered the second wave of infections,<sup id="cite_ref-gKU7Q_371-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gKU7Q-371">&#91;365&#93;</a></sup> although a WHO official disagreed with that assessment.<sup id="cite_ref-tfxTS_372-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tfxTS-372">&#91;366&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Europe">Europe</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Europe" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Europe">COVID-19 pandemic in Europe</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a href="/wiki/File:COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg/300px-COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg.png" decoding="async" width="300" height="304" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg/450px-COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg/600px-COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1440" data-file-height="1457" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:COVID-19_outbreak_Europe_per_capita_cases_map.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Cases of COVID-19 per 100,000 residents in Europe. The numbers are not comparable, as the testing strategy differs among countries and time periods.</div></div></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>As of 13&#160;March&#160;2020,<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup> when the number of new cases of <a href="/wiki/COVID-19" title="COVID-19">coronavirus disease 2019</a> (COVID-19) became greater  than those in China, the <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization" title="World Health Organization">World Health Organization</a> (WHO) began to consider Europe the active centre of the COVID-19 pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Europe_Centre_373-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Europe_Centre-373">&#91;367&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-374" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-374">&#91;368&#93;</a></sup> Cases by country across Europe had doubled over periods of typically 3 to 4 days, with some countries (mostly those at earlier stages of detection) showing doubling every 2 days.<sup id="cite_ref-375" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-375">&#91;369&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>As of 17 March,<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup> all countries within Europe had a confirmed case of <a href="/wiki/Coronavirus_disease_2019" class="mw-redirect" title="Coronavirus disease 2019">COVID-19</a>, with <a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a> being the last European country to report at least one case.<sup id="cite_ref-376" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-376">&#91;370&#93;</a></sup> At least one death has been reported in all European countries, apart from the <a href="/wiki/Vatican_City" title="Vatican City">Vatican City</a>.\n</p><p>As of 18 March,<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup> more than 250&#160;million people were in <a href="/wiki/Stay-at-home_order" title="Stay-at-home order">lockdown</a> in Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-377" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-377">&#91;371&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\nAs of 24 May, 68 days since its first recorded case, <a href="/wiki/Montenegro" title="Montenegro">Montenegro</a> became the first COVID-19-free country in Europe,<sup id="cite_ref-378" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-378">&#91;372&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-379" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-379">&#91;373&#93;</a></sup> but this situation lasted only 44 days before a newly imported case was identified there.<sup id="cite_ref-380" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-380">&#91;374&#93;</a></sup> European countries with the highest number of confirmed COVID-19 cases are <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Russia" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Russia">Russia</a>, the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom">United Kingdom</a>,  <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_France" title="COVID-19 pandemic in France">France</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Spain">Spain</a>, and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Italy" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Italy">Italy</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Europe_jhumap_381-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Europe_jhumap-381">&#91;375&#93;</a></sup></div></div>\n<p>On 21 August, it was reported the COVID-19 cases were climbing among younger individuals across Europe.<sup id="cite_ref-HFR3b_382-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HFR3b-382">&#91;376&#93;</a></sup> On 21 November, it was reported by the Voice of America that Europe is the worst hit area by the COVID-19 virus, with numbers exceeding 15&#160;million cases.<sup id="cite_ref-383" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-383">&#91;377&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="France">France</span></h4>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><div id="mwe_player_4" class="PopUpMediaTransform" style="width:220px;" videopayload="&lt;div class=&quot;mediaContainer&quot; style=&quot;width:854px&quot;&gt;&lt;video id=&quot;mwe_player_5&quot; poster=&quot;//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/854px--Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.jpg&quot; controls=&quot;&quot; preload=&quot;none&quot; autoplay=&quot;&quot; style=&quot;width:854px;height:480px&quot; class=&quot;kskin&quot; data-durationhint=&quot;74.802&quot; data-startoffset=&quot;0&quot; data-mwtitle=&quot;Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm&quot; data-mwprovider=&quot;wikimediacommons&quot;&gt;&lt;source src=&quot;//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.480p.vp9.webm&quot; type=&quot;video/webm; codecs=&amp;quot;vp9, opus&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;SD VP9 (480P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;VP9 480P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;480p.vp9.webm&quot; data-width=&quot;854&quot; data-height=&quot;480&quot; data-bandwidth=&quot;1069224&quot; data-framerate=&quot;29.97&quot;/&gt;&lt;source \xc3\x97 1,080 (10.51 Mbps)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;WebM source&quot; data-width=&quot;1920&quot; data-height=&quot;1080&quot; data-bandwidth=&quot;10514434&quot; data-framerate=&quot;29.97&quot;/&gt;&lt;source src=&quot;//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.120p.vp9.webm&quot; type=&quot;video/webm; codecs=&amp;quot;vp9, opus&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;Lowest bandwidth VP9 (120P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;VP9 120P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;120p.vp9.webm&quot; vorbis&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;Low bandwidth WebM (160P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;WebM 160P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;160p.webm&quot; data-width=&quot;284&quot; data-height=&quot;160&quot; data-bandwidth=&quot;231656&quot; data-framerate=&quot;29.97&quot;/&gt;&lt;source opus&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;Low bandwidth VP9 (180P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;VP9 180P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;180p.vp9.webm&quot; data-width=&quot;320&quot; src=&quot;//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.240p.webm&quot; type=&quot;video/webm; codecs=&amp;quot;vp8, vorbis&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;Small WebM (240P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;WebM 240P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;240p.webm&quot; data-width=&quot;426&quot; data-height=&quot;240&quot; data-bandwidth=&quot;332856&quot; data-framerate=&quot;29.97&quot;/&gt;&lt;source src=&quot;//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.240p.vp9.webm&quot; type=&quot;video/webm; codecs=&amp;quot;vp9, opus&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;Small VP9 (240P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;VP9 240P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;240p.vp9.webm&quot; data-width=&quot;426&quot; data-height=&quot;240&quot; data-bandwidth=&quot;348000&quot; data-framerate=&quot;29.97&quot;/&gt;&lt;source src=&quot;//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.360p.vp9.webm&quot; type=&quot;video/webm; codecs=&amp;quot;vp9, opus&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;VP9 (360P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;VP9 360P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;360p.vp9.webm&quot; data-width=&quot;640&quot; data-height=&quot;360&quot; data-bandwidth=&quot;587400&quot; data-framerate=&quot;29.97&quot;/&gt;&lt;source src=&quot;//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.360p.webm&quot; type=&quot;video/webm; codecs=&amp;quot;vp8, vorbis&amp;quot;&quot; data-title=&quot;WebM (360P)&quot; data-shorttitle=&quot;WebM 360P&quot; data-transcodekey=&quot;360p.webm&quot; data-width=&quot;640&quot; data-height=&quot;360&quot; data-bandwidth=&quot;587896&quot; data-framerate=&quot;29.97&quot;/&gt;&lt;/video&gt;&lt;/div&gt;"><img alt="File:Paris Covid19 Avril 2020.webm" style="width:220px;height:124px" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm/220px--Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm.jpg" /><a
