href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/25/Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm" title="Play media" target="new"><span class="play-btn-large"><span class="mw-tmh-playtext">Play media</span></span></a></div>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Paris_Covid19_Avril_2020.webm" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Empty streets in Paris, 2020</div></div></div>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_France" title="COVID-19 pandemic in France">COVID-19 pandemic in France</a></div>\n<p>Although it was originally thought the pandemic reached France on 24 January 2020, when the first COVID-19 case in Europe was confirmed in <a href="/wiki/Bordeaux" title="Bordeaux">Bordeaux</a>, it was later discovered that a person near Paris had tested positive for the virus on 27 December 2019 after retesting old samples.<sup id="cite_ref-France-retest_249-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-France-retest-249">&#91;243&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Deslandes_2020_250-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Deslandes_2020-250">&#91;244&#93;</a></sup> A key event in the spread of the disease in the country was the annual assembly of the <a href="/wiki/Christian_Open_Door_Church" title="Christian Open Door Church">Christian Open Door Church</a> between 17 and 24 February in <a href="/wiki/Mulhouse" title="Mulhouse">Mulhouse</a>, which was attended by about 2,500 people, at least half of whom are believed to have contracted the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-lepoint2369173_384-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lepoint2369173-384">&#91;378&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-francetvinfo3889133_385-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-francetvinfo3889133-385">&#91;379&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 13 March, Prime Minister <a href="/wiki/%C3%89douard_Philippe" title="\xc3\x89douard Philippe">\xc3\x89douard Philippe</a> ordered the closure of all non-essential public places,<sup id="cite_ref-bbc51892477_386-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc51892477-386">&#91;380&#93;</a></sup> and on 16 March, French President <a href="/wiki/Emmanuel_Macron" title="Emmanuel Macron">Emmanuel Macron</a> announced mandatory home confinement, a policy which was extended at least until 11 May.<sup id="cite_ref-independent9405136_387-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-independent9405136-387">&#91;381&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-macron13april_388-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-macron13april-388">&#91;382&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ft529354_389-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ft529354-389">&#91;383&#93;</a></sup> As of 14 September<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>, France has reported more than 402,000 confirmed cases, 30,000 deaths, and 90,000 recoveries,<sup id="cite_ref-dashboard_Covid19_France_390-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dashboard_Covid19_France-390">&#91;384&#93;</a></sup> ranking fourth in number of confirmed cases.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoQ7-3_391-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoQ7-3-391">&#91;385&#93;</a></sup> In April, there were riots in some <a href="/wiki/Banlieue" title="Banlieue">Paris suburbs</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-washingtonpost9881111_392-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-washingtonpost9881111-392">&#91;386&#93;</a></sup> On 18 May, it was reported that schools in France had to close again after reopening, due to COVID-19 case flare-ups.<sup id="cite_ref-iqGod_393-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iqGod-393">&#91;387&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 12 November, it was reported that France had become the worst-hit country by the COVID-19 pandemic, in all of Europe, in the process surpassing Russia. The new total of confirmed cases was more than 1.8&#160;million and counting; additionally it was indicated by the French government that the current national lockdown would remain in place.<sup id="cite_ref-W4fOQ_394-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-W4fOQ-394">&#91;388&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Italy">Italy</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Italy" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Italy">COVID-19 pandemic in Italy</a></div>\n<p>The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January 2020, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.<sup id="cite_ref-Corriere_20Jan_244-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Corriere_20Jan-244">&#91;238&#93;</a></sup> Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.<sup id="cite_ref-thelocal-flight_395-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-thelocal-flight-395">&#91;389&#93;</a></sup> An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in <a href="/wiki/Lombardy" title="Lombardy">Lombardy</a> on 21 February 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-ThomReut_IT_16cluster_21Feb_396-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ThomReut_IT_16cluster_21Feb-396">&#91;390&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Emergenza_coronavirus_(49496308758).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/Emergenza_coronavirus_%2849496308758%29.jpg/220px-Emergenza_coronavirus_%2849496308758%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/Emergenza_coronavirus_%2849496308758%29.jpg/330px-Emergenza_coronavirus_%2849496308758%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/Emergenza_coronavirus_%2849496308758%29.jpg/440px-Emergenza_coronavirus_%2849496308758%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1361" data-file-height="1020" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Emergenza_coronavirus_(49496308758).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Protezione_Civile" title="Protezione Civile">Civil Protection</a> volunteers conduct health checks at the <a href="/wiki/Guglielmo_Marconi_Airport" class="mw-redirect" title="Guglielmo Marconi Airport">Guglielmo Marconi Airport</a> in <a href="/wiki/Bologna" title="Bologna">Bologna</a> on 5<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>February 2020.</div></div></div>\n<p>On 22 February 2020, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from eleven different municipalities in northern Italy.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-201_397-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-201-397">&#91;391&#93;</a></sup> Prime Minister <a href="/wiki/Giuseppe_Conte" title="Giuseppe Conte">Giuseppe Conte</a> said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided. Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-202_398-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-202-398">&#91;392&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-203_399-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-203-399">&#91;393&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 4 March 2020, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached a hundred deaths. All major sporting events were to be held behind closed doors until April,<sup id="cite_ref-gZcpG_400-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gZcpG-400">&#91;394&#93;</a></sup> but on 9<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.<sup id="cite_ref-Kv4Ld_401-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kv4Ld-401">&#91;395&#93;</a></sup> On 11 March 2020, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.<sup id="cite_ref-SWDJe_402-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SWDJe-402">&#91;396&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-1B1Ui_403-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1B1Ui-403">&#91;397&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 6 March 2020, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published <a href="/wiki/Medical_ethics" title="Medical ethics">medical ethics</a> recommendations regarding <a href="/wiki/Triage" title="Triage">triage</a> protocols.<sup id="cite_ref-ZtNSb_404-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ZtNSb-404">&#91;398&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-dKNFI_405-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dKNFI-405">&#91;399&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-uSIDF_406-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-uSIDF-406">&#91;400&#93;</a></sup> On 19 March 2020, Italy overtook China as the country with the most COVID-19-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-To26Y_407-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-To26Y-407">&#91;401&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-ClzT6_408-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ClzT6-408">&#91;402&#93;</a></sup> On 22 March 2020, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.<sup id="cite_ref-20200323euractiv_409-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200323euractiv-409">&#91;403&#93;</a></sup> As of 28 March<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>, there were 3,532,057 confirmed cases, 107,933 deaths, and 2,850,889 recoveries in Italy, with a large number of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.<sup id="cite_ref-JHU_ticker_4-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-JHU_ticker-4">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup> A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy\'s large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.<sup id="cite_ref-PJt9i_410-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PJt9i-410">&#91;404&#93;</a></sup> On 19 April 2020, it was reported that the country had its lowest deaths at 433 in seven days and some businesses were asking for a loosening of restrictions after six weeks of lockdown.<sup id="cite_ref-thehill493586_411-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-thehill493586-411">&#91;405&#93;</a></sup>\nOn 13 October 2020, the Italian government again issued restrictive rules to contain a rise in infections.<sup id="cite_ref-KhaW7_412-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-KhaW7-412">&#91;406&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 11 November, it was reported that Silvestro Scotti, president of the Italian Federation of General Practitioners indicated that all of Italy should come under restrictions due to the spread of COVID-19. A couple of days prior Filippo Anelli, president of the National Federation of Doctor\'s Guilds (FNOMCEO) asked for a complete lockdown of the peninsular nation due to the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-Fe7MN_413-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fe7MN-413">&#91;407&#93;</a></sup> On the 10th, a day before, Italy surpassed 1&#160;million confirmed COVID-19 cases.<sup id="cite_ref-8XEwk_414-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8XEwk-414">&#91;408&#93;</a></sup> On 23 November, it was reported that the second wave of the virus has caused some hospitals in Italy to stop accepting patients.<sup id="cite_ref-415" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-415">&#91;409&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Spain">Spain</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Spain">COVID-19 pandemic in Spain</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg/220px-2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg/330px-2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/02/2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg/440px-2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4128" data-file-height="3096" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:2020-03-Detalls_i_conseq%C3%BC%C3%A8ncies_del_COVID-19_al_Pa%C3%ADs_Valenci%C3%A0_14.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Residents of <a href="/wiki/Valencia" title="Valencia">Valencia</a>, Spain, maintaining social distancing while queueing (20 March 2020)</div></div></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>The virus was first confirmed to have spread to <a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a> on 31 January 2020, when a German tourist tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in <a href="/wiki/La_Gomera" title="La Gomera">La Gomera</a>, <a href="/wiki/Canary_Islands" title="Canary Islands">Canary Islands</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_SanidadConfirmaEnLaGomera_416-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_SanidadConfirmaEnLaGomera-416">&#91;410&#93;</a></sup> Post-hoc genetic analysis has shown that at least 15 strains of the virus had been imported, and <a href="/wiki/Transmission_(medicine)#Definition_and_related_terms" title="Transmission (medicine)">community transmission</a> began by mid-February.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_genetic_analysis_417-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_genetic_analysis-417">&#91;411&#93;</a></sup> By 13 March, cases had been confirmed in all 50 provinces of the country.\n</p><p>A lockdown was imposed on 14 March 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-418" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-418">&#91;412&#93;</a></sup> On 29 March, it was announced that, beginning the following day, all non-essential workers were ordered to remain at home for the next 14 days.<sup id="cite_ref-419" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-419">&#91;413&#93;</a></sup> By late March, the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_Community_of_Madrid" title="COVID-19 pandemic in the Community of Madrid">Community of Madrid</a> has recorded the most cases and deaths in the country. Medical professionals and those who live in retirement homes have experienced especially high infection rates.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_IrishTimes_420-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_IrishTimes-420">&#91;414&#93;</a></sup> On 25 March, the official death toll in Spain surpassed <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_mainland_China" title="COVID-19 pandemic in mainland China">that of mainland China</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-421" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-421">&#91;415&#93;</a></sup> On 2<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>April, 950 people died of the virus in a 24-hour period\xe2\x80\x94at the time, the most by any country in a single day.<sup id="cite_ref-422" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-422">&#91;416&#93;</a></sup> On 17 May, the daily death toll announced by the Spanish government fell below 100 for the first time,<sup id="cite_ref-423" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-423">&#91;417&#93;</a></sup> and 1 June was the first day without deaths by COVID-19.<sup id="cite_ref-424" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-424">&#91;418&#93;</a></sup> The state of alarm ended on 21 June.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_2020-06-22-elpais_425-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_2020-06-22-elpais-425">&#91;419&#93;</a></sup> However, the number of cases increased again in July in a number of cities including <a href="/wiki/Barcelona" title="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, <a href="/wiki/Zaragoza" title="Zaragoza">Zaragoza</a> and <a href="/wiki/Madrid" title="Madrid">Madrid</a>, which led to reimposition of some restrictions but no national lockdown.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_bbc25july_426-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_bbc25july-426">&#91;420&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_elpais6aug_427-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_elpais6aug-427">&#91;421&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_telegraph_aug16_428-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_telegraph_aug16-428">&#91;422&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-429" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-429">&#91;423&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\nStudies have suggested that the number of infections and deaths may have been underestimated due to lack of testing and reporting, and many people with only mild or no symptoms were not tested.<sup id="cite_ref-430" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-430">&#91;424&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-431" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-431">&#91;425&#93;</a></sup> Reports in May suggested that, based on a sample of more than 63,000 people, the number of infections may be ten times higher than the number of confirmed cases by that date, and <a href="/wiki/Community_of_Madrid" title="Community of Madrid">Madrid</a> and several provinces of <a href="/wiki/Castilla%E2%80%93La_Mancha" title="Castilla\xe2\x80\x93La Mancha">Castilla\xe2\x80\x93La Mancha</a> and <a href="/wiki/Castile_and_Le%C3%B3n" title="Castile and Le\xc3\xb3n">Castile and Le\xc3\xb3n</a> were the most affected areas with a percentage of infection greater than 10%.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_Europa_Press-20200513_432-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_Europa_Press-20200513-432">&#91;426&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_El_Mundo-20200513_433-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_El_Mundo-20200513-433">&#91;427&#93;</a></sup> There may also be as many as 15,815 more deaths according to the <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Spain)" title="Ministry of Health (Spain)">Spanish Ministry of Health</a> monitoring system on daily <a href="/wiki/Mortality_displacement" title="Mortality displacement">excess mortality</a> (Sistema de Monitorizaci\xc3\xb3n de la Mortalidad Diaria - MoMo).<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_El_Pa\xc3\xads-20200527_434-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_El_Pa\xc3\xads-20200527-434">&#91;428&#93;</a></sup> On 6 July 2020, the results of a <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Spain" title="Government of Spain">Government of Spain</a> nationwide seroprevalence study showed that about two million people, or 5.2% of the population, could have been infected during the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_RTVE-20200706_435-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_RTVE-20200706-435">&#91;429&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_El_Pa\xc3\xads-20200706_436-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_El_Pa\xc3\xads-20200706-436">&#91;430&#93;</a></sup> Spain was the second country in Europe (behind <a href="/wiki/Russia" title="Russia">Russia</a>) to record half a million cases.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_half_million_437-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Spain_half_million-437">&#91;431&#93;</a></sup> On 21 October, Spain passed 1 million COVID-19 cases, with 1,005,295 infections and 34,366 deaths reported, a third of which occurred in Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-438" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-438">&#91;432&#93;</a></sup></div></div>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Sweden">Sweden</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Sweden" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Sweden">COVID-19 pandemic in Sweden</a></div>\n<p>Sweden differed from most other European countries in that it mostly remained open.<sup id="cite_ref-NYT20200515_439-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NYT20200515-439">&#91;433&#93;</a></sup> Per the Swedish Constitution, the <a href="/wiki/Public_Health_Agency_of_Sweden" title="Public Health Agency of Sweden">Public Health Agency of Sweden</a> has autonomy which prevents political interference and the agency\'s policy favoured forgoing a lockdown. The Swedish strategy focused on measures that could be put in place over a longer period of time, based on the assumption that the virus would start spreading again after a shorter lockdown.<sup id="cite_ref-7ys2k_440-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7ys2k-440">&#91;434&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-I06mN_441-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-I06mN-441">&#91;435&#93;</a></sup> <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i> said that, as of May 2020, the outbreak had been far deadlier there but the economic impact had been reduced as Swedes have continued to go to work, restaurants, and shopping.<sup id="cite_ref-NYT20200515_439-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NYT20200515-439">&#91;433&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BloombergOpen_442-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BloombergOpen-442">&#91;436&#93;</a></sup> On 19 May, it was reported that the country had in the week of 12\xe2\x80\x9319 May the highest per capita deaths in Europe, 6.25 deaths per million per day.<sup id="cite_ref-yahoo162855274_443-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-yahoo162855274-443">&#91;437&#93;</a></sup> In the end of June, Sweden no longer had <a href="/wiki/Excess_mortality" class="mw-redirect" title="Excess mortality">excess mortality</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HEUrz_444-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HEUrz-444">&#91;438&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="United_Kingdom">United Kingdom</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom">COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom</a></div>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_England" title="COVID-19 pandemic in England">COVID-19 pandemic in England</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Northern_Ireland" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Northern Ireland">COVID-19 pandemic in Northern Ireland</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Scotland" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Scotland">COVID-19 pandemic in Scotland</a>, and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Wales" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Wales">COVID-19 pandemic in Wales</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Wee_Annie,_Kempock_Street,_face_mask.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Wee_Annie%2C_Kempock_Street%2C_face_mask.jpg/170px-Wee_Annie%2C_Kempock_Street%2C_face_mask.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="213" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Wee_Annie%2C_Kempock_Street%2C_face_mask.jpg/255px-Wee_Annie%2C_Kempock_Street%2C_face_mask.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Wee_Annie%2C_Kempock_Street%2C_face_mask.jpg/340px-Wee_Annie%2C_Kempock_Street%2C_face_mask.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2292" data-file-height="2877" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Wee_Annie,_Kempock_Street,_face_mask.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The "Wee Annie" statue in <a href="/wiki/Gourock,_Scotland" class="mw-redirect" title="Gourock, Scotland">Gourock, Scotland</a>, was given a face mask during the pandemic.</div></div></div>\n<p><a href="/wiki/Devolution_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="Devolution in the United Kingdom">Devolution in the United Kingdom</a> meant that each of the four <a href="/wiki/Countries_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Countries of the United Kingdom">countries of the UK</a> had its own different response to COVID-19, and the UK government, on behalf of England, moved quicker to lift restrictions.<sup id="cite_ref-8VnMf_445-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8VnMf-445">&#91;439&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Government_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Government of the United Kingdom">UK government</a> started enforcing social distancing and quarantine measures on 18 March 2020<sup id="cite_ref-PkWGD_446-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PkWGD-446">&#91;440&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Pkx25_447-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pkx25-447">&#91;441&#93;</a></sup> and was criticised for a perceived lack of intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.<sup id="cite_ref-LlWkl_448-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LlWkl-448">&#91;442&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-nsOiP_449-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nsOiP-449">&#91;443&#93;</a></sup> On 16 March, Prime Minister <a href="/wiki/Boris_Johnson" title="Boris Johnson">Boris Johnson</a> advised against non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.<sup id="cite_ref-5Q93q_450-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5Q93q-450">&#91;444&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-hYdUy_451-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hYdUy-451">&#91;445&#93;</a></sup> On 20 March, the government ordered all leisure establishments to close as soon as possible,<sup id="cite_ref-dmBNt_452-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dmBNt-452">&#91;446&#93;</a></sup> and promised to prevent unemployment.<sup id="cite_ref-mV2p3_453-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mV2p3-453">&#91;447&#93;</a></sup> On 23 March, Johnson banned gatherings of multiple people and restricting non-essential travel and outdoor activity. Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through fines and dispersal of gatherings. Most non-essential businesses were ordered to close.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc-pm-2403_454-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc-pm-2403-454">&#91;448&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 24 April, it was reported that a promising vaccine trial had begun in England; the government pledged more than \xc2\xa350&#160;million towards research.<sup id="cite_ref-vKeXC_455-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-vKeXC-455">&#91;449&#93;</a></sup> A number of <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_hospitals_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="COVID-19 hospitals in the United Kingdom">temporary critical care hospitals</a> were built.<sup id="cite_ref-20200330nursingtimes_456-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200330nursingtimes-456">&#91;450&#93;</a></sup> The first operating was the 4,000-bed <a href="/wiki/NHS_Nightingale_Hospital_London" title="NHS Nightingale Hospital London">NHS Nightingale Hospital London</a>, constructed for over nine days.<sup id="cite_ref-20200403theguardian_457-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200403theguardian-457">&#91;451&#93;</a></sup> On 4<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>May, it was announced that it would be placed on standby and remaining patients transferred to other facilities;<sup id="cite_ref-bbc52531845_458-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc52531845-458">&#91;452&#93;</a></sup> 51 patients had been treated in the first three weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc52448982_459-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc52448982-459">&#91;453&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 16 April, it was reported that the UK would have first access to the Oxford vaccine, due to a prior contract; should the trial be successful, some 30&#160;million doses in the UK would be available.<sup id="cite_ref-Lbt4o_460-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Lbt4o-460">&#91;454&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 2 December, the UK became the first Western country to approve the Pfizer vaccine against the COVID-19 virus; 800,000 doses would be immediately available for use.<sup id="cite_ref-461" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-461">&#91;455&#93;</a></sup> It was reported on 5 December that the United Kingdom <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_vaccination_programme_in_the_United_Kingdom" class="mw-redirect" title="COVID-19 vaccination programme in the United Kingdom">would begin vaccination</a> against the virus on 8 December, less than a week after having been approved.<sup id="cite_ref-462" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-462">&#91;456&#93;</a></sup> On 9 December, MHRA stated that any individual with a significant allergic reaction to a vaccine, such as an anaphylactoid reaction, should not take the Pfizer vaccine for COVID-19 protection.<sup id="cite_ref-463" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-463">&#91;457&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-464" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-464">&#91;458&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="North_America">North America</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_North_America" title="COVID-19 pandemic in North America">COVID-19 pandemic in North America</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>The first cases in North America were reported in the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States" title="COVID-19 pandemic in the United States">United States</a> in January 2020. Cases were reported in all North American countries after <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Saint_Kitts_and_Nevis" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Saint Kitts and Nevis">Saint Kitts and Nevis</a> confirmed a case on 25 March, and in all North American territories after <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Bonaire" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Bonaire">Bonaire</a> confirmed a case on 16 April.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_North_America_FirstBonaire_local_465-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_North_America_FirstBonaire_local-465">&#91;459&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\nAs of 6 May 2021, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Canada" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Canada">Canada</a> has reported 1,265,320 cases and 24,489 deaths,<sup id="cite_ref-466" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-466">&#91;460&#93;</a></sup> while <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Mexico" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Mexico">Mexico</a> has reported 2,355,985 cases and 177,061 deaths.<sup id="cite_ref-467" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-467">&#91;461&#93;</a></sup> The most cases by state is California with 3,753,509 cases and 62,163 deaths as of 6 May 2021.<sup id="cite_ref-468" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-468">&#91;462&#93;</a></sup></div></div>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="United_States">United States</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States" title="COVID-19 pandemic in the United States">COVID-19 pandemic in the United States</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg/220px-USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="156" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg/330px-USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg/440px-USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg 2x" data-file-width="6905" data-file-height="4903" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:USNS_Comfort_New_York_City_2020.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The hospital ship <a href="/wiki/USNS_Comfort_(T-AH-20)" title="USNS Comfort (T-AH-20)">USNS <i>Comfort</i></a> arrives in <a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">Manhattan</a> on 30 March 2020.</div></div></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>More than 32.6 million confirmed cases have been reported in the United States since January 2020, resulting in more than 580,000 deaths, the most of any country, and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_death_rates_by_country" title="COVID-19 pandemic death rates by country">the seventeenth-highest</a> per capita worldwide.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_JHU_469-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_JHU-469">&#91;463&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_JH_Mortality_470-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_JH_Mortality-470">&#91;464&#93;</a></sup> The U.S. has about one fifth of the world\'s cases and deaths. More Americans have died from COVID-19 than died <a href="/wiki/United_States_military_casualties_of_war" title="United States military casualties of war">during both World Wars and the Vietnam War</a> combined.<sup id="cite_ref-471" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-471">&#91;465&#93;</a></sup> COVID-19 became the third-leading cause of death in the U.S. in 2020, behind heart disease and cancer.<sup id="cite_ref-472" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-472">&#91;466&#93;</a></sup> U.S. life expectancy dropped from 78.8 years in 2019 to 77.8 years in the first half of 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_Marchione_473-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_Marchione-473">&#91;467&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The first American case was reported on January 20, and President <a href="/wiki/Donald_Trump" title="Donald Trump">Donald Trump</a> declared the U.S. outbreak a <a href="/wiki/Public_health_emergency_(United_States)" title="Public health emergency (United States)">public health emergency</a> on January 31. Restrictions were placed on flights arriving from China,<sup id="cite_ref-474" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-474">&#91;468&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_RobertsonApril15_475-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_RobertsonApril15-475">&#91;469&#93;</a></sup> but the initial U.S. response to the pandemic was otherwise slow, in terms of preparing the healthcare system, stopping other travel, and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_testing_in_the_United_States" title="COVID-19 testing in the United States">testing</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-476" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-476">&#91;470&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_:10_477-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_:10-477">&#91;471&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-478" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-478">&#91;472&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-480" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-480">&#91;g&#93;</a></sup> Meanwhile, Trump remained optimistic and underestimated the degree of the spread of COVID-19 in the United States.\n</p>\nThe first known American deaths occurred in February.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_freqTraveller_481-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_freqTraveller-481">&#91;474&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-482" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-482">&#91;h&#93;</a></sup> On March 6, 2020, Trump signed the <a href="/wiki/Coronavirus_Preparedness_and_Response_Supplemental_Appropriations_Act,_2020" title="Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2020">Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act</a>, which provided $8.3<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.<sup id="cite_ref-483" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-483">&#91;475&#93;</a></sup> On March 13, President Trump declared a <a href="/wiki/State_of_emergency" title="State of emergency">national emergency</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_LiptakMarch13_484-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_LiptakMarch13-484">&#91;476&#93;</a></sup> In mid-March, the Trump administration started to purchase large quantities of medical equipment,<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_BieseckerApril7_485-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_BieseckerApril7-485">&#91;477&#93;</a></sup> and in late March, it invoked the <a href="/wiki/Defense_Production_Act_of_1950" title="Defense Production Act of 1950">Defense Production Act of 1950</a> to direct industries to produce medical equipment.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_WatsonMarch27_486-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_WatsonMarch27-486">&#91;478&#93;</a></sup> By April 17, the federal government approved disaster declarations for all states and territories. By mid-April, cases had been confirmed in all fifty <a href="/wiki/U.S._state" title="U.S. state">U.S. states</a>, and by November in all inhabited <a href="/wiki/Territories_of_the_United_States" title="Territories of the United States">U.S. territories</a>.</div></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="South_America">South America</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_South_America" title="COVID-19 pandemic in South America">COVID-19 pandemic in South America</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>The pandemic was confirmed to have reached <a href="/wiki/South_America" title="South America">South America</a> on 26 February 2020 when <a href="/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil">Brazil</a> confirmed a case in <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo" title="S\xc3\xa3o Paulo">S\xc3\xa3o Paulo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-487" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-487">&#91;479&#93;</a></sup> By 3 April, all countries and territories in South America had recorded at least one case.<sup id="cite_ref-Stuff/Fairfax_488-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Stuff/Fairfax-488">&#91;480&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 13 May, it was reported that Latin America and the <a href="/wiki/Caribbean" title="Caribbean">Caribbean</a> had reported over 400,000 cases of COVID-19 infection with, 23,091 deaths. On 22 May, citing the rapid increase of infections <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Brazil" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Brazil">in Brazil</a>, the WHO declared South America the epicentre of the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-489" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-489">&#91;481&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-490" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-490">&#91;482&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\nAs of 16 March 2021, South America had recorded 19,446,936 confirmed cases and 503,030 deaths from COVID-19. Due to a shortage of testing and medical facilities, it is believed that the outbreak is far larger than the official numbers show.<sup id="cite_ref-491" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-491">&#91;483&#93;</a></sup></div></div>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Brazil">Brazil</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Brazil" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Brazil">COVID-19 pandemic in Brazil</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:(2020.04.17)_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_(49784811813).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/%282020.04.17%29_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_%2849784811813%29.jpg/220px-%282020.04.17%29_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_%2849784811813%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/%282020.04.17%29_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_%2849784811813%29.jpg/330px-%282020.04.17%29_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_%2849784811813%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f9/%282020.04.17%29_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_%2849784811813%29.jpg/440px-%282020.04.17%29_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_%2849784811813%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4555" data-file-height="3037" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:(2020.04.17)_Higieniza%C3%A7%C3%A3o_entrada_esta%C3%A7%C3%A3o_da_CPTM_(49784811813).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Disinfection of public area in <a href="/wiki/Itapevi" title="Itapevi">Itapevi, Brazil</a>.</div></div></div>\n<p>On 20 May, it was reported that Brazil had a record 1,179 deaths in a single day, for a total of almost 18,000 fatalities. With a total number of almost 272,000 cases, Brazil became the country with the third-highest number of cases, following Russia and the United States.<sup id="cite_ref-20200520reuters_492-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200520reuters-492">&#91;484&#93;</a></sup> On 25 May, Brazil exceeded the number of reported cases in Russia when they reported that 11,687 new cases had been confirmed over the previous 24 hours, bringing the total number to over 374,800, with more than 23,400 deaths. President <a href="/wiki/Jair_Bolsonaro" title="Jair Bolsonaro">Jair Bolsonaro</a> has created controversy by referring to the virus as a "little flu" and frequently speaking out against preventive measures such as lockdowns and quarantines. His attitude towards the outbreak has been likened to that of former U.S. President Trump, with Bolsonaro being called the "Trump of the Tropics".<sup id="cite_ref-9hz3E_493-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9hz3E-493">&#91;485&#93;</a></sup> Bolsonaro later tested positive for the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-D2hqe_494-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-D2hqe-494">&#91;486&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>In June 2020, the <a href="/wiki/Federal_government_of_Brazil" title="Federal government of Brazil">government of Brazil</a> attempted to conceal the actual figures of the COVID-19 active cases and deaths, as it stopped publishing the total number of infections and deaths. On 5<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>June, <a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Brazil)" title="Ministry of Health (Brazil)">Brazil\'s health ministry</a> took down the official website reflecting the total numbers of infections and deaths. The website was live on 6<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>June, with only the number of infections of the previous 24 hours. The last official numbers reported about 615,000 infections and over 34,000 deaths.<sup id="cite_ref-c803k_495-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-c803k-495">&#91;487&#93;</a></sup> On 15 June, it was reported that the worldwide cases had jumped from seven to eight million in one week, citing Latin America, specifically Brazil as one of the countries where cases are surging, in this case, towards 1&#160;million cases.<sup id="cite_ref-H8V6v_496-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-H8V6v-496">&#91;488&#93;</a></sup> Brazil briefly paused Phase III trials for the Coronavac COVID-19 vaccine on 10 November after the suicide of a volunteer before resuming on 11 November.<sup id="cite_ref-:4_497-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:4-497">&#91;489&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>By early 2021, the death toll had climbed to 231,534. The total number of cases on 7 February exceeded 9.5 million. The only countries with worse outbreaks were India and the United States.<sup id="cite_ref-498" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-498">&#91;490&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Africa">Africa</span></h3>\n<div class="excerpt"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Africa" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Africa">COVID-19 pandemic in Africa</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_(49829156488).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_%2849829156488%29.jpg/220px-Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_%2849829156488%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_%2849829156488%29.jpg/330px-Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_%2849829156488%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_%2849829156488%29.jpg/440px-Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_%2849829156488%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="7360" data-file-height="4912" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Air_Forces_Africa_delivers_medical_supplies_to_Ghana_(49829156488).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/United_States_Air_Force" title="United States Air Force">U.S. Air Force</a> personnel unload a <a href="/wiki/Boeing_C-17_Globemaster_III" title="Boeing C-17 Globemaster III">C-17</a> aircraft carrying approximately 1,800&#160;kg (4,000&#160;lb) of medical supplies in <a href="/wiki/Niamey,_Niger" class="mw-redirect" title="Niamey, Niger">Niamey, Niger</a>.</div></div></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>The pandemic was confirmed to have spread to Africa on 14 February 2020, with the first confirmed case announced in <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Egypt" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Egypt">Egypt</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-499" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-499">&#91;491&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-500" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-500">&#91;492&#93;</a></sup> The first confirmed case in <a href="/wiki/Sub-Saharan_Africa" title="Sub-Saharan Africa">sub-Saharan Africa</a> was announced in <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Nigeria" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Nigeria">Nigeria</a> at the end of February.<sup id="cite_ref-501" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-501">&#91;493&#93;</a></sup> Within three months, the virus had spread throughout the continent, as <a href="/wiki/Lesotho" title="Lesotho">Lesotho</a>, the last African sovereign state to have remained free of the virus, reported a case on 13 May.<sup id="cite_ref-502" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-502">&#91;494&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Africa_latimes.com_503-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Africa_latimes.com-503">&#91;495&#93;</a></sup> By 26 May, it appeared that most African countries were experiencing community transmission, although testing capacity was limited.<sup id="cite_ref-504" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-504">&#91;496&#93;</a></sup> Most of the identified imported cases arrived from <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">Europe</a> and the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a> rather than from <a href="/wiki/China" title="China">China</a> where the virus originated.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Africa_Africa_Braces_505-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Africa_Africa_Braces-505">&#91;497&#93;</a></sup> It is believed that there is widespread <a href="/wiki/Under-reporting" title="Under-reporting">under-reporting</a> in many African countries with less developed <a href="/wiki/Healthcare_system" class="mw-redirect" title="Healthcare system">healthcare systems</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-506" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-506">&#91;498&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>New strains of the virus were found in December 2020 in South Africa and Nigeria, in addition to the <a href="/wiki/Lineage_B.1.1.7" title="Lineage B.1.1.7">Lineage B.1.1.7</a> variant reported in the United Kingdom in September.<sup id="cite_ref-507" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-507">&#91;499&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\nThe <a href="/wiki/African_Union" title="African Union">African Union</a> secured close to 300 million <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_vaccine" title="COVID-19 vaccine">COVID-19 vaccine</a> doses in the largest such agreement yet for Africa; it was announced on 13 January 13 2021. This is independent of the global <a href="/wiki/Access_to_COVID-19_Tools_Accelerator" title="Access to COVID-19 Tools Accelerator">Access to COVID-19 Tools Accelerator</a> (<a href="/wiki/COVAX" title="COVAX">COVAX</a>) effort aimed at distributing COVID-19 vaccines to lower-income countries.<sup id="cite_ref-508" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-508">&#91;500&#93;</a></sup> Notably, however, African countries were being charged more than double what European countries had to pay for certain vaccines.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Africa_price_509-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Africa_price-509">&#91;501&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Group_of_Seven" title="Group of Seven">Group of Seven</a> (G-7) promised an equitable distribution of vaccines on 19 February 2021, although few details were provided.<sup id="cite_ref-510" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-510">&#91;502&#93;</a></sup> Despite these breakthroughs, Africa is the world\'s least vaccinated continent.<sup id="cite_ref-511" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-511">&#91;503&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Oceania">Oceania</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Oceania" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Oceania">COVID-19 pandemic in Oceania</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\nThe pandemic was confirmed to have reached <a href="/wiki/Oceania" title="Oceania">Oceania</a> on 25 January 2020 with the first confirmed case reported in <a href="/wiki/Melbourne" title="Melbourne">Melbourne</a>, <a href="/wiki/Victoria_(Australia)" title="Victoria (Australia)">Victoria</a>, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Australia" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Australia">Australia</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Oceania_AustraliaCase1_512-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Oceania_AustraliaCase1-512">&#91;504&#93;</a></sup> It has since spread elsewhere in the region,<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Oceania_WHO_Dashboard_513-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Oceania_WHO_Dashboard-513">&#91;505&#93;</a></sup> although many small Pacific <a href="/wiki/Island_country" title="Island country">island nations</a> have thus far avoided the outbreak by closing their international borders. Five Oceania sovereign states have yet to report a case: <a href="/wiki/Kiribati" title="Kiribati">Kiribati</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nauru" title="Nauru">Nauru</a>, <a href="/wiki/Palau" title="Palau">Palau</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tonga" title="Tonga">Tonga</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Tuvalu" title="Tuvalu">Tuvalu</a>. Australia and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_New_Zealand" title="COVID-19 pandemic in New Zealand">New Zealand</a> have been praised for their handling of the pandemic compared to other western nations, with both New Zealand and each of Australia\'s states wiping out all community transmission of the virus several times even after being re-introduced into the community.<sup id="cite_ref-514" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-514">&#91;506&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-515" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-515">&#91;507&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-516" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-516">&#91;508&#93;</a></sup> The most recent country or territory to report its first confirmed case was the <a href="/wiki/Federated_States_of_Micronesia" title="Federated States of Micronesia">Federated States of Micronesia</a> on 8 January 2021.</div></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Antarctica">Antarctica</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic_in_Antarctica" title="COVID-19 pandemic in Antarctica">COVID-19 pandemic in Antarctica</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\nDue to its remoteness and sparse population, Antarctica was the last <a href="/wiki/Continent" title="Continent">continent</a> to have confirmed cases of COVID-19 and was one of the last regions of the world affected directly by the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Antarctica_:0_517-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Antarctica_:0-517">&#91;509&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-518" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-518">&#91;510&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-519" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-519">&#91;511&#93;</a></sup> The first cases were reported in December 2020, almost a year after the first cases of COVID-19 were detected in China. At least 36 people are confirmed to have been infected.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Antarctica_:2_520-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_Antarctica_:2-520">&#91;512&#93;</a></sup> Even before the first cases on the continent were reported, human activity in Antarctica was indirectly impacted.</div></div>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="International_responses">International responses</span></h2>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic">Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic</a> and <a href="/wiki/International_aid_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="International aid related to the COVID-19 pandemic">International aid related to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<p>The COVID-19 pandemic shook the world\'s economy, with especially severe economic damage in the United States, Europe, and Latin America.<sup id="cite_ref-521" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-521">&#91;513&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-522" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-522">&#91;514&#93;</a></sup> A consensus report by American intelligence agencies in April 2021 concluded, "Efforts to contain and manage the virus have reinforced nationalist trends globally, as some states turned inward to protect their citizens and sometimes cast blame on marginalized groups." Furthermore, COVID-19 has inflamed partisanship and polarization around the world as bitter arguments explode over who to scapegoat and who to help first. The risks include further disruption of international trade and the formation of no-entry enclaves.<sup id="cite_ref-523" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-523">&#91;515&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Travel_restrictions">Travel restrictions</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Travel_restrictions_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Travel restrictions related to the COVID-19 pandemic">Travel restrictions related to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<p>As a result of the pandemic, many countries and regions imposed quarantines, entry bans, or other restrictions, either for citizens, recent travellers to affected areas,<sup id="cite_ref-20200326nytimes_524-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200326nytimes-524">&#91;516&#93;</a></sup> or for all travellers.<sup id="cite_ref-Kh5YZ_525-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kh5YZ-525">&#91;517&#93;</a></sup> Together with a decreased willingness to travel, this had a <a href="/wiki/Economic_impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic">negative economic</a> and <a href="/wiki/Social_impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Social impact of the COVID-19 pandemic">social impact</a> on the travel sector. Concerns have been raised over the effectiveness of travel restrictions to contain the spread of COVID-19.<sup id="cite_ref-20200224nationalgeographic_526-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200224nationalgeographic-526">&#91;518&#93;</a></sup> A study in <i><a href="/wiki/Science_(journal)" title="Science (journal)">Science</a></i> found that travel restrictions had only modestly affected the initial spread of COVID-19, unless combined with <a href="/wiki/Infection_prevention_and_control" title="Infection prevention and control">infection prevention and control</a> measures to considerably reduce transmissions.<sup id="cite_ref-DJYtB_527-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DJYtB-527">&#91;519&#93;</a></sup> Researchers concluded that "travel restrictions are most useful in the early and late phase of an epidemic" and "restrictions of travel from Wuhan unfortunately came too late".<sup id="cite_ref-283GD_528-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-283GD-528">&#91;520&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a> rejected the idea of suspending the <a href="/wiki/Schengen_Agreement" title="Schengen Agreement">Schengen free travel zone</a> and introducing border controls with Italy,<sup id="cite_ref-dw52497811_529-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dw52497811-529">&#91;521&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200313euractiv_530-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200313euractiv-530">&#91;522&#93;</a></sup> a decision which has been criticised by some European politicians.<sup id="cite_ref-scmp3073897_531-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-scmp3073897-531">&#91;523&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200226nytimes_532-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200226nytimes-532">&#91;524&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Evacuation_of_foreign_citizens">Evacuation of foreign citizens</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Evacuations_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Evacuations related to the COVID-19 pandemic">Evacuations related to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg/220px-Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="138" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg/330px-Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg/440px-Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1280" data-file-height="804" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ukraine_evacuates_Ukrainian_and_foreign_citizens_from_Wuhan_16.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ukraine evacuates Ukrainian and foreign citizens from <a href="/wiki/Wuhan" title="Wuhan">Wuhan</a>, China.</div></div></div>\n<p>Owing to the effective lockdown of Wuhan and Hubei, several countries evacuated their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through <a href="/wiki/Air_charter" title="Air charter">chartered flights</a> of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance. Canada, the United States, Japan, India,<sup id="cite_ref-FLdHv_533-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FLdHv-533">&#91;525&#93;</a></sup> Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-169_534-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-169-534">&#91;526&#93;</a></sup> Brazil and New Zealand also evacuated their own nationals and some other people.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-171_535-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-171-535">&#91;527&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-6l9jG_536-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6l9jG-536">&#91;528&#93;</a></sup> On 14 March 2020, South Africa repatriated 112 South Africans who tested negative for the virus from Wuhan, while four who showed symptoms were left behind to mitigate risk.<sup id="cite_ref-auto3_537-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-auto3-537">&#91;529&#93;</a></sup> Pakistan said it would not evacuate citizens from China.<sup id="cite_ref-20200131dialoguepakistan_538-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200131dialoguepakistan-538">&#91;530&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 15 February 2020, the U.S. announced it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship <i><a href="/wiki/Diamond_Princess_outbreak" class="mw-redirect" title="Diamond Princess outbreak">Diamond Princess</a></i>,<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-174_539-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-174-539">&#91;531&#93;</a></sup> and on 21 February, Canada evacuated 129 Canadian passengers from the ship.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-175_540-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-175-540">&#91;532&#93;</a></sup> In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.<sup id="cite_ref-czjOG_541-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-czjOG-541">&#91;533&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-indiatimes74647353_542-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-indiatimes74647353-542">&#91;534&#93;</a></sup> On 20 March, the United States began to partially <a href="/wiki/Withdrawal_of_U.S._troops_from_Iraq_(2020)" class="mw-redirect" title="Withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq (2020)">withdraw its troops from Iraq</a> due to the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-USWithdraw_543-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-USWithdraw-543">&#91;535&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="United_Nations_response_measures">United Nations response measures</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_response_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="United Nations response to the COVID-19 pandemic">United Nations response to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<p>The <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a> response to the pandemic has been led by its <a href="/wiki/Secretary-General_of_the_United_Nations" title="Secretary-General of the United Nations">Secretary-General</a> and can be divided into formal <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_resolution" title="United Nations resolution">resolutions</a> at the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly" title="United Nations General Assembly">General Assembly</a> and the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council" title="United Nations Security Council">Security Council</a> (UNSC), and operations via its specialised <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_System" title="United Nations System">agencies.</a><sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (November 2020)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup>\n</p><p>In June 2020, the Secretary-General launched its \'UN Comprehensive Response to COVID-19\'.<sup id="cite_ref-Krm4a_544-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Krm4a-544">&#91;536&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Conference_on_Trade_and_Development" title="United Nations Conference on Trade and Development">United Nations Conference on Trade and Development</a> (UNSC) has been criticised for a slow coordinated response, especially regarding the UN\'s <a href="/wiki/Global_ceasefire" title="Global ceasefire">global ceasefire</a>, which aims to open up humanitarian access to the world\'s most vulnerable in conflict zones.<sup id="cite_ref-:22_545-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:22-545">&#91;537&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="WHO_response_measures">WHO response measures</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization%27s_response_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="World Health Organization&#39;s response to the COVID-19 pandemic">World Health Organization\'s response to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>The WHO is a leading organisation involved in the global coordination for mitigating the pandemic. \n</p><p>The WHO has spearheaded several initiatives like the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_Solidarity_Response_Fund" title="COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund">COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund</a> to raise money for the pandemic response, the <a href="/wiki/UN_COVID-19_Supply_Chain_Task_Force" title="UN COVID-19 Supply Chain Task Force">UN COVID-19 Supply Chain Task Force</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Solidarity_trial" title="Solidarity trial">solidarity trial</a> for investigating potential treatment options for the disease. The WHO\'s <a href="/wiki/COVAX" title="COVAX">COVAX</a> vaccine-sharing program aims to distribute 2 billion doses of COVID-19 vaccine for free or at a reduced cost by the end of 2021,<sup id="cite_ref-World_Health_Organization&#39;s_response_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic_ft.c_WHOw_546-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-World_Health_Organization&#39;s_response_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic_ft.c_WHOw-546">&#91;538&#93;</a></sup> and has begun distributing them.\n</p>\nThe WHO\'s handling of the initial outbreak of the pandemic has required a "diplomatic balancing act" between member states, in particular between the United States and China.<sup id="cite_ref-World_Health_Organization&#39;s_response_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic_Guardian-superpower-struggle_547-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-World_Health_Organization&#39;s_response_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic_Guardian-superpower-struggle-547">&#91;539&#93;</a></sup> On August 27, the WHO announced the setting up of an independent expert Review Committee to examine aspects of the international treaty that governs preparedness and response to health emergencies. A WHO-led international mission arrived in China in January 2021 to <a href="/wiki/Investigations_into_the_origin_of_COVID-19" title="Investigations into the origin of COVID-19">investigate the origins of the COVID-19 pandemic</a> and released preliminary findings in February 2021.</div></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Protests_against_governmental_measures">Protests against governmental measures</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Protests_over_responses_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Protests over responses to the COVID-19 pandemic">Protests over responses to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<p>In several countries, protests have risen against governmental restrictive responses to the COVID-19 pandemic, such as lockdowns. A February 2021 study found that large protest rallies against coronavirus measures are likely to directly increase the spread of viruses including the coronavirus.<sup id="cite_ref-548" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-548">&#91;540&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Impact">Impact</span></h2>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Social_impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Social impact of the COVID-19 pandemic">Social impact of the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Economics">Economics</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Economic_impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic">Economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_aviation" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on aviation">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on aviation</a>, <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_science_and_technology" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on science and technology">on science and technology</a>, <a href="/wiki/Financial_market_impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Financial market impact of the COVID-19 pandemic">on financial markets</a>, <a href="/wiki/2020_stock_market_crash" title="2020 stock market crash">2020 stock market crash</a>, and <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_recession" title="COVID-19 recession">COVID-19 recession</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:292px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg/290px-Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg.png" decoding="async" width="290" height="218" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg/435px-Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg/580px-Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="504" data-file-height="378" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Stock-indices-2020crash%2Brecovery.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A <a href="/wiki/Stock_index" class="mw-redirect" title="Stock index">stock index</a> chart shows the <a href="/wiki/2020_stock_market_crash" title="2020 stock market crash">2020 stock market crash</a>.</div></div></div>\n<p>The outbreak is a major destabilising threat to the global economy. Agathe Demarais of the <a href="/wiki/Economist_Intelligence_Unit" title="Economist Intelligence Unit">Economist Intelligence Unit</a> has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes. One estimate from an expert at <a href="/wiki/Washington_University_in_St._Louis" title="Washington University in St. Louis">Washington University in St. Louis</a> gave a $300+<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>billion impact on the world\'s supply chain that could last up to two years.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-268_549-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-268-549">&#91;541&#93;</a></sup> Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside China.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-270_550-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-270-550">&#91;542&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-271_551-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-271-551">&#91;543&#93;</a></sup> On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the COVID-19 outbreak, U.S. stock indexes posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the <a href="/wiki/Dow_Jones_Industrial_Average" title="Dow Jones Industrial Average">Dow</a> falling 1,191 points (the largest one-day drop since the <a href="/wiki/Financial_crisis_of_2007%E2%80%9308" class="mw-redirect" title="Financial crisis of 2007\xe2\x80\x9308">financial crisis of 2007\xe2\x80\x9308</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-S6DVx_552-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-S6DVx-552">&#91;544&#93;</a></sup> and all three major indexes ending the week down more than 10 percent.<sup id="cite_ref-U7teI_553-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-U7teI-553">&#91;545&#93;</a></sup> On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China\'s sovereign credit rating but maintained a Negative Outlook.<sup id="cite_ref-NRWqJ_554-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NRWqJ-554">&#91;546&#93;</a></sup> Stocks plunged again due to coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.<sup id="cite_ref-m0beI_555-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-m0beI-555">&#91;547&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p><a href="/wiki/Lloyd%27s_of_London" title="Lloyd&#39;s of London">Lloyd\'s of London</a> has estimated that the global insurance industry will absorb losses of US$204&#160;billion, exceeding the losses from the <a href="/wiki/2017_Atlantic_hurricane_season" title="2017 Atlantic hurricane season">2017 Atlantic hurricane season</a> and <a href="/wiki/September_11_attacks" title="September 11 attacks">11 September attacks</a>, suggesting the COVID-19 pandemic will likely go down in history as the costliest disaster ever in human history.<sup id="cite_ref-jJAfD_556-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-jJAfD-556">&#91;548&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto,_March_2020_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto%2C_March_2020_%28cropped%29.jpg/220px-COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto%2C_March_2020_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="146" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto%2C_March_2020_%28cropped%29.jpg/330px-COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto%2C_March_2020_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto%2C_March_2020_%28cropped%29.jpg/440px-COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto%2C_March_2020_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2493" data-file-height="1654" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:COVID-19_highway_sign_in_Toronto,_March_2020_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A highway sign in <a href="/wiki/Toronto" title="Toronto">Toronto</a> discouraging non-essential travel during the pandemic lockdown in March 2020</div></div></div>\n<p>Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against travel. Numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, and British regional airline <a href="/wiki/Flybe" title="Flybe">Flybe</a> collapsed.<sup id="cite_ref-z2VrM_557-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-z2VrM-557">&#91;549&#93;</a></sup> The cruise line industry was hard hit,<sup id="cite_ref-smh20200227_558-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-smh20200227-558">&#91;550&#93;</a></sup> and several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.<sup id="cite_ref-wnn7L_559-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wnn7L-559">&#91;551&#93;</a></sup> International mail between some countries stopped or was delayed due to reduced transportation between them or suspension of domestic service.<sup id="cite_ref-wsj1158868721_560-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-wsj1158868721-560">&#91;552&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.<sup id="cite_ref-4QUSL_561-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4QUSL-561">&#91;553&#93;</a></sup> Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40 percent. North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50\xe2\x80\x9360 percent drop.<sup id="cite_ref-20200402aislelabs_562-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200402aislelabs-562">&#91;554&#93;</a></sup> This also resulted in a 33\xe2\x80\x9343 percent drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February. Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such as increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.<sup id="cite_ref-J6Y6Z_563-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-J6Y6Z-563">&#91;555&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_(49935630543).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_%2849935630543%29.jpg/220px-Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_%2849935630543%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="155" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_%2849935630543%29.jpg/330px-Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_%2849935630543%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_%2849935630543%29.jpg/440px-Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_%2849935630543%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5165" data-file-height="3640" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Memorial_Day_2020_-_San_Francisco_Under_Quarantine_(49935630543).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>A socially distanced homeless encampment in <a href="/wiki/San_Francisco" title="San Francisco">San Francisco</a>, <a href="/wiki/California" title="California">California</a>, in May 2020</div></div></div>\n<p>Hundreds of millions of jobs could be lost globally.<sup id="cite_ref-aljazeera2004271718_564-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-aljazeera2004271718-564">&#91;556&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200506csmonitor_565-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200506csmonitor-565">&#91;557&#93;</a></sup> More than 40&#160;million Americans <a href="/wiki/Unemployment_in_the_United_States" title="Unemployment in the United States">lost their jobs</a> and filed <a href="/wiki/Unemployment_insurance" class="mw-redirect" title="Unemployment insurance">unemployment insurance</a> claims.<sup id="cite_ref-20200528WaPo_566-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200528WaPo-566">&#91;558&#93;</a></sup> The economic impact and mass unemployment caused by the pandemic has raised fears of a mass <a href="/wiki/Eviction_in_the_United_States" title="Eviction in the United States">eviction crisis</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-CvJoN_567-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CvJoN-567">&#91;559&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DqnOV_568-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DqnOV-568">&#91;560&#93;</a></sup> with an analysis by the <a href="/wiki/Aspen_Institute" title="Aspen Institute">Aspen Institute</a> indicating between
