30&#160;and&#160;40&#160;million Americans are at risk for eviction by the end of 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-BPAdu_569-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BPAdu-569">&#91;561&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DuTwi_570-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DuTwi-570">&#91;562&#93;</a></sup> According to a report by <a href="/wiki/Yelp" title="Yelp">Yelp</a>, about 60% of U.S. businesses that have closed since the start of the pandemic will stay shut permanently.<sup id="cite_ref-vLHxV_571-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-vLHxV-571">&#91;563&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>According to a <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Economic_Commission_for_Latin_America_and_the_Caribbean" title="United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean">United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America</a> estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave 14\xe2\x80\x9322&#160;million more people in <a href="/wiki/Extreme_poverty" title="Extreme poverty">extreme poverty</a> in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-20200403elpais_572-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200403elpais-572">&#91;564&#93;</a></sup> According to the <a href="/wiki/World_Bank" title="World Bank">World Bank</a>, up to 100&#160;million more people globally could fall into extreme poverty due to the shutdowns.<sup id="cite_ref-Extreme_poverty_1_573-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Extreme_poverty_1-573">&#91;565&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Extreme_poverty_3_574-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Extreme_poverty_3-574">&#91;566&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/International_Labour_Organization" title="International Labour Organization">International Labour Organization</a> (ILO) informed that the income generated in the first nine months of 2020 from work across the world dropped by 10.7 per cent, or $3.5&#160;trillion, amidst the COVID-19 outbreak.<sup id="cite_ref-rd8bm_575-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-rd8bm-575">&#91;567&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Supply_shortages">Supply shortages</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Shortages_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Shortages related to the COVID-19 pandemic">Shortages related to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ntuc_super_store,_Singapore_(49505410793).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Ntuc_super_store%2C_Singapore_%2849505410793%29.jpg/220px-Ntuc_super_store%2C_Singapore_%2849505410793%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Ntuc_super_store%2C_Singapore_%2849505410793%29.jpg/330px-Ntuc_super_store%2C_Singapore_%2849505410793%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Ntuc_super_store%2C_Singapore_%2849505410793%29.jpg/440px-Ntuc_super_store%2C_Singapore_%2849505410793%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4032" data-file-height="3024" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ntuc_super_store,_Singapore_(49505410793).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Coronavirus fears have led to panic buying of essentials across the world, including <a href="/wiki/Toilet_paper" title="Toilet paper">toilet paper</a>, dried and <a href="/wiki/Instant_noodles" class="mw-redirect" title="Instant noodles">instant noodles</a>, bread, rice, vegetables, disinfectant, and <a href="/wiki/Rubbing_alcohol" title="Rubbing alcohol">rubbing alcohol</a>.</div></div></div>\n<p>The outbreak has been blamed for several instances of <a href="/wiki/Shortage" title="Shortage">supply shortages</a>, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight outbreaks, panic buying (which in several places led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water), and disruption to factory and logistic operations.<sup id="cite_ref-XvcU9_576-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-XvcU9-576">&#91;568&#93;</a></sup> The spread of panic buying has been found to stem from perceived threat, perceived scarcity, fear of the unknown, coping behaviour and social psychological factors (e.g. <a href="/wiki/Social_influence" title="Social influence">social influence</a> and trust).<sup id="cite_ref-cSvA4_577-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cSvA4-577">&#91;569&#93;</a></sup> The technology industry, in particular, has warned of delays to shipments of electronic goods.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-263_578-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-263-578">&#91;570&#93;</a></sup> According to the WHO director-general <a href="/wiki/Tedros_Adhanom" title="Tedros Adhanom">Tedros Adhanom</a>, demand for personal protection equipment has risen a hundredfold, leading to prices up to twenty times the normal price and also delays in the supply of medical items of four to six months.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-275_579-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-275-579">&#91;571&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-276_580-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-276-580">&#91;572&#93;</a></sup> It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.<sup id="cite_ref-Mycfo_581-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Mycfo-581">&#91;573&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The impact of the COVID-19 outbreak was worldwide. The virus created a shortage of <a href="/wiki/Precursor_(chemistry)" title="Precursor (chemistry)">precursors</a> (raw material) used in the manufacturing of <a href="/wiki/Fentanyl" title="Fentanyl">fentanyl</a> and <a href="/wiki/Methamphetamine" title="Methamphetamine">methamphetamine</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Yuancheng_Group" title="Yuancheng Group">Yuancheng Group</a>, headquartered in Wuhan, is one of the leading suppliers.<sup id="cite_ref-DSstandaard_582-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DSstandaard-582">&#91;574&#93;</a></sup> Price increases and shortages in these illegal drugs have been noticed on the streets of the UK.<sup id="cite_ref-Guardian_583-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Guardian-583">&#91;575&#93;</a></sup> U.S. law enforcement also told the <i><a href="/wiki/New_York_Post" title="New York Post">New York Post</a></i> Mexican <a href="/wiki/Drug_cartel" title="Drug cartel">drug cartels</a> were having difficulty in obtaining precursors.<sup id="cite_ref-NY_Post_584-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NY_Post-584">&#91;576&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The pandemic has disrupted global <a href="/wiki/Food_security" title="Food security">food supplies</a> and threatens to trigger a new <a href="/wiki/Food_crisis" class="mw-redirect" title="Food crisis">food crisis</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-20200414foreignpolicy_585-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200414foreignpolicy-585">&#91;577&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-aljazeera2004211359_586-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-aljazeera2004211359-586">&#91;578&#93;</a></sup> David Beasley, head of the <a href="/wiki/World_Food_Programme" title="World Food Programme">World Food Programme</a> (WFP), said "we could be facing multiple <a href="/wiki/Famine" title="Famine">famines</a> of biblical proportions within a short few months."<sup id="cite_ref-bbc52373888_587-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc52373888-587">&#91;579&#93;</a></sup> Senior officials at the United Nations estimated in April 2020 that an additional 130&#160;million people could <a href="/wiki/Starvation" title="Starvation">starve</a>, for a total of 265&#160;million by the end of 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc52373888_587-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc52373888-587">&#91;579&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200421un_588-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200421un-588">&#91;580&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200422nytimes_589-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200422nytimes-589">&#91;581&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Oil_and_other_energy_markets">Oil and other energy markets</span></h4>\n<p>In early February 2020, <a href="/wiki/OPEC" title="OPEC">Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries</a> (OPEC) "scrambled" after a steep decline in <a href="/wiki/Price_of_oil" title="Price of oil">oil prices</a> due to lower demand from China.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-269_590-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-269-590">&#91;582&#93;</a></sup> On Monday, 20 April, the price of West Texas Intermediate (WTI) went negative and fell to a record low (minus $37.63 a barrel) due to traders\' offloading holdings so as not to take delivery and incur storage costs.<sup id="cite_ref-BBC,_US_oil_prices,_21_April_2020_591-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBC,_US_oil_prices,_21_April_2020-591">&#91;583&#93;</a></sup> June prices were down but in the positive range, with a barrel of West Texas trading above $20.<sup id="cite_ref-BBC,_US_oil_prices,_21_April_2020_591-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBC,_US_oil_prices,_21_April_2020-591">&#91;583&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Culture">Culture</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/List_of_events_affected_by_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="List of events affected by the COVID-19 pandemic">List of events affected by the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<p>The performing arts and <a href="/wiki/Cultural_heritage_sector" class="mw-redirect" title="Cultural heritage sector">cultural heritage sectors</a> have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organisations\' operations as well as individuals\xe2\x80\x94both employed and independent\xe2\x80\x94globally. Arts and culture sector organisations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible. By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.<sup id="cite_ref-v5Qlx_592-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-v5Qlx-592">&#91;584&#93;</a></sup> In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.<sup id="cite_ref-ZljIY_593-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ZljIY-593">&#91;585&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Burke2020_594-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Burke2020-594">&#91;586&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SxIEK_595-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SxIEK-595">&#91;587&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg" class="image"><img alt="A man wearing purple vestments and standing at an altar uses a mobile phone camera to record himself. Empty pews are visible in the background." src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg/220px-Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="157" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg/330px-Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg/440px-Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2100" data-file-height="1500" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Religious_service_live-streaming_during_the_2020_coronavirus_pandemic.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>An American Catholic military chaplain prepares for a live-streamed <a href="/wiki/Mass_(liturgy)" title="Mass (liturgy)">Mass</a> in an empty chapel at <a href="/wiki/Offutt_Air_Force_Base" title="Offutt Air Force Base">Offutt Air Force Base</a> in March 2020.</div></div></div>\n<p><a href="/wiki/Holy_Week" title="Holy Week">Holy Week</a> observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of <a href="/wiki/Lent" title="Lent">Lent</a>, were cancelled.<sup id="cite_ref-Burke2020_594-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Burke2020-594">&#91;586&#93;</a></sup> Many <a href="/wiki/Diocese" title="Diocese">dioceses</a> have recommended older Christians stay home rather than attend <a href="/wiki/Mass_(liturgy)" title="Mass (liturgy)">Mass</a> on <a href="/wiki/Lord%27s_Day" title="Lord&#39;s Day">Sundays</a>; <a href="/wiki/Church_service" title="Church service">services</a> have been made available via radio, online live streaming and television, though some congregations have made provisions for drive-in worship.<sup id="cite_ref-Burke2020_594-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Burke2020-594">&#91;586&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Parke2020_596-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Parke2020-596">&#91;588&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Qpm1n_597-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Qpm1n-597">&#91;589&#93;</a></sup> With the <a href="/wiki/Diocese_of_Rome" title="Diocese of Rome">Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome</a> closing its churches and chapels and <a href="/wiki/St._Peter%27s_Square" title="St. Peter&#39;s Square">St. Peter\'s Square</a> emptied of <a href="/wiki/Christian_pilgrimage" title="Christian pilgrimage">Christian pilgrims</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Burke2020_594-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Burke2020-594">&#91;586&#93;</a></sup> other religious bodies also cancelled in-person services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and <a href="/wiki/Gurdwara" title="Gurdwara">gurdwaras</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Burke2020_594-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Burke2020-594">&#91;586&#93;</a></sup> Iran\'s Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed,<sup id="cite_ref-Urdn6_332-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Urdn6-332">&#91;326&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-iran_shrines_339-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iran_shrines-339">&#91;333&#93;</a></sup> while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.<sup id="cite_ref-HFdq4_598-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HFdq4-598">&#91;590&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-V8C1i_599-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-V8C1i-599">&#91;591&#93;</a></sup> The 2020 <a href="/wiki/Hajj" title="Hajj">Hajj</a> <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_Hajj" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on Hajj">was limited</a> to around 1,000 selected pilgrims, in contrast to the usual number of over 2&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-fKNfU_600-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fKNfU-600">&#91;592&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the <a href="/wiki/Second_World_War" class="mw-redirect" title="Second World War">Second World War</a>. Most major sporting events have been cancelled or postponed, including the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2019\xe2\x80\x9320 UEFA Champions League">2019\xe2\x80\x9320 UEFA Champions League</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-8med7_601-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8med7-601">&#91;593&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Premier_League" title="2019\xe2\x80\x9320 Premier League">2019\xe2\x80\x9320 Premier League</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-sSb4h_602-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-sSb4h-602">&#91;594&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2020" title="UEFA Euro 2020">UEFA Euro 2020</a>, <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_NBA_season" title="2019\xe2\x80\x9320 NBA season">2019\xe2\x80\x9320 NBA season</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-HY7m9_603-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HY7m9-603">&#91;595&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_NHL_season" title="2019\xe2\x80\x9320 NHL season">2019\xe2\x80\x9320 NHL season</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-rixzT_604-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-rixzT-604">&#91;596&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/2020_Arctic_Winter_Games" title="2020 Arctic Winter Games">2020 Arctic Winter Games</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-605" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-605">&#91;597&#93;</a></sup> The outbreak disrupted plans for the <a href="/wiki/2020_Summer_Olympics" title="2020 Summer Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="/wiki/Tokyo" title="Tokyo">Tokyo</a>, Japan, which were originally scheduled to start at 24 July 2020, and were postponed by the <a href="/wiki/International_Olympic_Committee" title="International Olympic Committee">International Olympic Committee</a> to 23 July 2021.<sup id="cite_ref-fqsQg_606-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-fqsQg-606">&#91;598&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Postponement_607-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Postponement-607">&#91;599&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-IOC_2021_Dates_608-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IOC_2021_Dates-608">&#91;600&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The entertainment industry has also been affected, with many music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.<sup id="cite_ref-qpQAN_609-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-qpQAN-609">&#91;601&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-3qWDp_610-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3qWDp-610">&#91;602&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest_2020" title="Eurovision Song Contest 2020">Eurovision Song Contest</a>, which was due to be held in <a href="/wiki/Rotterdam" title="Rotterdam">Rotterdam</a>, the Netherlands in May, was cancelled; however, the Netherlands was retained as host for <a href="/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest_2021" title="Eurovision Song Contest 2021">2021</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-bbc51870325_611-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbc51870325-611">&#91;603&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-pWPb2_612-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pWPb2-612">&#91;604&#93;</a></sup> Many large theatres such as those on <a href="/wiki/Broadway_theatre" title="Broadway theatre">Broadway</a> also suspended all performances.<sup id="cite_ref-XfQuW_613-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-XfQuW-613">&#91;605&#93;</a></sup> Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts<sup id="cite_ref-SZ5Mc_614-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SZ5Mc-614">&#91;606&#93;</a></sup> or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicise their work.<sup id="cite_ref-mYlLn_615-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mYlLn-615">&#91;607&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The large number of people working or learning from home via videoconferencing software led to several new terms and trends, including "<a href="/wiki/Zoom_fatigue" title="Zoom fatigue">Zoom fatigue</a>",<sup id="cite_ref-616" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-616">&#91;608&#93;</a></sup> a decline in demand for formal clothing, and increased fashion focus on masks and clothes for the upper body (the lower body generally not being visible on a videoconference).<sup id="cite_ref-617" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-617">&#91;609&#93;</a></sup> The term "<a href="/wiki/Doomscrolling" title="Doomscrolling">doomscrolling</a>" became more widely used. Online, numerous COVID-19-themed <a href="/wiki/Internet_meme" title="Internet meme">Internet memes</a> have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid the uncertainty.<sup id="cite_ref-Qc8ww_618-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Qc8ww-618">&#91;610&#93;</a></sup> A popular Twitter account called "Room Rater" jokingly commented on and assigned numerical scores to the backgrounds of journalists and others appearing in mass media from home.<sup id="cite_ref-619" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-619">&#91;611&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Politics">Politics</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_politics" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on politics">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on politics</a></div>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_international_relations" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on international relations">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on international relations</a></div>\n<p>The pandemic has affected the political systems of multiple countries, causing suspensions of legislative activities,<sup id="cite_ref-20200313nationalpost_620-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200313nationalpost-620">&#91;612&#93;</a></sup> isolations or deaths of multiple politicians,<sup id="cite_ref-20200318foreignpolicy_621-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200318foreignpolicy-621">&#91;613&#93;</a></sup> and rescheduling of elections due to fears of spreading the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-20200427nytimes_622-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200427nytimes-622">&#91;614&#93;</a></sup> Starting in late May, <a href="/wiki/George_Floyd_protests" title="George Floyd protests">large-scale protests</a> against police brutality in at least 200 U.S. cities and <a href="/wiki/List_of_George_Floyd_protests_outside_the_United_States" title="List of George Floyd protests outside the United States">later worldwide</a> in response to the <a href="/wiki/Killing_of_George_Floyd" class="mw-redirect" title="Killing of George Floyd">killing of George Floyd</a> raised <a href="/wiki/George_Floyd_protests#Impact_on_COVID-19_transmission" title="George Floyd protests">concerns of a resurgence of the virus</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-DpMvp_623-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DpMvp-623">&#91;615&#93;</a></sup> although research has determined that they were not.<sup id="cite_ref-624" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-624">&#91;616&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>Although they have broad support among epidemiologists, social distancing measures have been politically controversial in many countries. Intellectual opposition to social distancing has come primarily from writers of other fields, although there are a few heterodox epidemiologists.<sup id="cite_ref-74OHE_625-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-74OHE-625">&#91;617&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>On 23 March 2020, United Nations Secretary-General <a href="/wiki/Ant%C3%B3nio_Guterres" title="Ant\xc3\xb3nio Guterres">Ant\xc3\xb3nio Manuel de Oliveira Guterres</a> issued an appeal for a global ceasefire in response to the pandemic;<sup id="cite_ref-tFb4N_626-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tFb4N-626">&#91;618&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-lzoeV_627-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lzoeV-627">&#91;619&#93;</a></sup> 172 UN Member States and Observers signed a non-binding statement in support of the appeal in June,<sup id="cite_ref-AGhvz_628-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AGhvz-628">&#91;620&#93;</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/UN_Security_Council" class="mw-redirect" title="UN Security Council">UN Security Council</a> passed a <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2532" title="United Nations Security Council Resolution 2532">resolution</a> supporting it in July.<sup id="cite_ref-9rN79_629-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9rN79-629">&#91;621&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-nJTuX_630-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nJTuX-630">&#91;622&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="China_2">China</span></h4>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/China%E2%80%93United_States_relations#COVID-19" title="China\xe2\x80\x93United States relations">China\xe2\x80\x93United States relations \xc2\xa7&#160;COVID-19</a></div>\n<p>The government of China has been criticised by the <a href="/wiki/Federal_government_of_the_United_States" title="Federal government of the United States">United States</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-20200311foreignpolicy_631-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200311foreignpolicy-631">&#91;623&#93;</a></sup> the UK Minister for the Cabinet Office <a href="/wiki/Michael_Gove" title="Michael Gove">Michael Gove</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-xmEit_632-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-xmEit-632">&#91;624&#93;</a></sup> and others<sup id="cite_ref-20200319bloomberg_633-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200319bloomberg-633">&#91;625&#93;</a></sup> for its handling of the pandemic. A number of provincial-level administrators of the <a href="/wiki/Communist_Party_of_China" class="mw-redirect" title="Communist Party of China">Communist Party of China</a> were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine measures in China, a sign of discontent with their response to the outbreak. Some commentators believed this move was intended to protect CCP <a href="/wiki/General_Secretary_of_the_Communist_Party" title="General Secretary of the Communist Party">general secretary</a> <a href="/wiki/Xi_Jinping" title="Xi Jinping">Xi Jinping</a> from the controversy.<sup id="cite_ref-vLpPa_634-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-vLpPa-634">&#91;626&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/United_States_Intelligence_Community" title="United States Intelligence Community">U.S. intelligence community</a> claims China intentionally under-reported its number of COVID-19 cases.<sup id="cite_ref-20200402nytimes_635-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200402nytimes-635">&#91;627&#93;</a></sup> The Chinese government maintains it has acted swiftly and transparently.<sup id="cite_ref-hMc3w_636-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-hMc3w-636">&#91;628&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-NF0y6_637-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NF0y6-637">&#91;629&#93;</a></sup> However, journalists and activists who have reported on the pandemic have been detained by authorities,<sup id="cite_ref-638" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-638">&#91;630&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-639" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-639">&#91;631&#93;</a></sup> such as <a href="/wiki/Zhang_Zhan" title="Zhang Zhan">Zhang Zhan</a>, who was arrested and tortured for reporting on the pandemic and the detainment of other independent journalists.<sup id="cite_ref-640" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-640">&#91;632&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-641" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-641">&#91;633&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-642" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-642">&#91;634&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Italy_2">Italy</span></h4>\n<p>In early March, the Italian government criticised the EU\'s lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy<sup id="cite_ref-Y27Kh_643-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Y27Kh-643">&#91;635&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-91jge_644-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91jge-644">&#91;636&#93;</a></sup>\xe2\x80\x94Maurizio Massari, Italy\'s ambassador to the EU, said "only China responded bilaterally", not the EU.<sup id="cite_ref-politico-corona_645-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-politico-corona-645">&#91;637&#93;</a></sup> On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president <a href="/wiki/Vladimir_Putin" title="Vladimir Putin">Vladimir Putin</a> had the <a href="/wiki/Russian_Armed_Forces" title="Russian Armed Forces">Russian army</a> send military medics, disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.<sup id="cite_ref-reuters219081_646-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-reuters219081-646">&#91;638&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/President_of_Lombardy" title="President of Lombardy">President of Lombardy</a> <a href="/wiki/Attilio_Fontana" title="Attilio Fontana">Attilio Fontana</a> and Italian Foreign Minister <a href="/wiki/Luigi_Di_Maio" title="Luigi Di Maio">Luigi Di Maio</a> expressed their gratitude for the aid.<sup id="cite_ref-20200328insideover_647-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200328insideover-647">&#91;639&#93;</a></sup> Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.<sup id="cite_ref-20200401themoscowtimes_648-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200401themoscowtimes-648">&#91;640&#93;</a></sup> Kremlin spokesman <a href="/wiki/Dmitry_Peskov" title="Dmitry Peskov">Dmitry Peskov</a> said "when offering assistance to U.S. colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when U.S. manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."<sup id="cite_ref-aljazeera2004010659_649-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-aljazeera2004010659-649">&#91;641&#93;</a></sup>\nIn early April, <a href="/wiki/Norway" title="Norway">Norway</a> and EU states like <a href="/wiki/Romania" title="Romania">Romania</a> and <a href="/wiki/Austria" title="Austria">Austria</a> started to offer help by sending medical personnel and disinfectant,<sup id="cite_ref-eumedicalteams_650-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-eumedicalteams-650">&#91;642&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Ursula_von_der_Leyen" title="Ursula von der Leyen">Ursula von der Leyen</a> offered an official apology to the country.<sup id="cite_ref-euapology_651-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-euapology-651">&#91;643&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="United_States_2">United States</span></h4>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_(49799974031).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f2/Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_%2849799974031%29.jpg/220px-Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_%2849799974031%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="160" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f2/Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_%2849799974031%29.jpg/330px-Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_%2849799974031%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f2/Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_%2849799974031%29.jpg/440px-Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_%2849799974031%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1997" data-file-height="1450" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Open_Ohio_Rally_IMG_0910_(49799974031).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Several hundred anti-lockdown protesters rallied at the <a href="/wiki/Ohio_Statehouse" title="Ohio Statehouse">Ohio Statehouse</a> 20 April.<sup id="cite_ref-Columbus_Dispatch_652-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Columbus_Dispatch-652">&#91;644&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>\n<p>The outbreak prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including <a href="/wiki/Universal_health_care" title="Universal health care">universal health care</a>, <a href="/wiki/Universal_child_care" class="mw-redirect" title="Universal child care">universal child care</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paid_sick_leave" class="mw-redirect" title="Paid sick leave">paid sick leave</a>, and higher levels of funding for public health.<sup id="cite_ref-NYT_Calls_653-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NYT_Calls-653">&#91;645&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Hill5_654-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hill5-654">&#91;646&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Ddn2P_655-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ddn2P-655">&#91;647&#93;</a></sup> Political analysts believe it may have contributed to Donald Trump\'s loss in the <a href="/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election" title="2020 United States presidential election">2020 presidential election</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-TrumpChances_656-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TrumpChances-656">&#91;648&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-AtlanticChances_657-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AtlanticChances-657">&#91;649&#93;</a></sup> Beginning in mid-April 2020, there were <a href="/wiki/2020%E2%80%932021_United_States_anti-lockdown_protests" class="mw-redirect" title="2020\xe2\x80\x932021 United States anti-lockdown protests">protests</a> in several U.S. states against government-imposed business closures and restricted personal movement and association.<sup id="cite_ref-5YqAF_658-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5YqAF-658">&#91;650&#93;</a></sup> Simultaneously, protests ensued by <a href="/wiki/Essential_worker" class="mw-redirect" title="Essential worker">essential workers</a> in the form of a <a href="/wiki/2020_United_States_essential_workers_general_strike" class="mw-redirect" title="2020 United States essential workers general strike">general strike</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-c114M_659-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-c114M-659">&#91;651&#93;</a></sup> In early October 2020, Donald Trump, his family members, and many other government officials <a href="/wiki/White_House_COVID-19_outbreak" title="White House COVID-19 outbreak">were diagnosed with COVID-19</a>, further disrupting the country\'s politics.<sup id="cite_ref-EVG4L_660-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-EVG4L-660">&#91;652&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_countries">Other countries</span></h4>\n<p>The planned <a href="/wiki/NATO" title="NATO">NATO</a> "<a href="/wiki/List_of_NATO_exercises" title="List of NATO exercises">Defender 2020</a>" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the <a href="/wiki/Cold_War" title="Cold War">Cold War</a>, was held on a reduced scale.<sup id="cite_ref-20200320spectator_661-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200320spectator-661">&#91;653&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200319reuters_662-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200319reuters-662">&#91;654&#93;</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Campaign_for_Nuclear_Disarmament" title="Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament">Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament</a>\'s general secretary <a href="/wiki/Kate_Hudson_(activist)" title="Kate Hudson (activist)">Kate Hudson</a> criticised the exercise, saying "it jeopardises the lives not only of the troops from the U.S. and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."<sup id="cite_ref-20200318morningstaronline_663-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200318morningstaronline-663">&#91;655&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with about two dozen parliament members and fifteen current or former political figures infected.<sup id="cite_ref-D2Xpc_342-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-D2Xpc-342">&#91;336&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-nmEQ5_664-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nmEQ5-664">&#91;656&#93;</a></sup> Iran\'s President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying they were struggling to fight the outbreak due to a lack of access to international markets from the <a href="/wiki/United_States_sanctions_against_Iran" title="United States sanctions against Iran">United States sanctions against Iran</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-u2rRX_665-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-u2rRX-665">&#91;657&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Saudi_Arabia" title="Saudi Arabia">Saudi Arabia</a>, which launched a <a href="/wiki/Saudi_Arabian-led_intervention_in_Yemen" title="Saudi Arabian-led intervention in Yemen">military intervention in Yemen</a> in March 2015, declared a ceasefire.<sup id="cite_ref-20200409foreignpolicy_666-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200409foreignpolicy-666">&#91;658&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p><a href="/wiki/Japan%E2%80%93South_Korea_relations" title="Japan\xe2\x80\x93South Korea relations">Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea</a> worsened due to the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-z8lBE_667-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-z8lBE-667">&#91;659&#93;</a></sup> South Korea criticised Japan\'s "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anyone coming from South Korea would be placed in quarantine for two weeks at government-designated sites.<sup id="cite_ref-HnqN4_668-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HnqN4-668">&#91;660&#93;</a></sup> South Korean society was initially polarised on President Moon Jae-in\'s response to the crisis; many Koreans signed petitions either calling for Moon\'s <a href="/wiki/Impeachment" title="Impeachment">impeachment</a> or praising his response.<sup id="cite_ref-imx38_366-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-imx38-366">&#91;360&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>Some countries have passed emergency legislation in response to the pandemic. Some commentators have expressed concern that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.<sup id="cite_ref-20200331theguardian_669-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200331theguardian-669">&#91;661&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200330nytimes_670-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200330nytimes-670">&#91;662&#93;</a></sup> In the Philippines, lawmakers granted president <a href="/wiki/Rodrigo_Duterte" title="Rodrigo Duterte">Rodrigo Duterte</a> temporary emergency powers during the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-abcnews-censorship_671-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-abcnews-censorship-671">&#91;663&#93;</a></sup> In Hungary, the parliament voted to allow the prime minister, <a href="/wiki/Viktor_Orb%C3%A1n" title="Viktor Orb\xc3\xa1n">Viktor Orb\xc3\xa1n</a>, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections, and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government\'s handling of the crisis.<sup id="cite_ref-20200330cnn_672-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200330cnn-672">&#91;664&#93;</a></sup> In some countries, including <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">Egypt</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-dw53009293_673-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dw53009293-673">&#91;665&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Turkey" title="Turkey">Turkey</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-20200401foreignpolicy_674-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200401foreignpolicy-674">&#91;666&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Thailand" title="Thailand">Thailand</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-abcnews-censorship_671-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-abcnews-censorship-671">&#91;663&#93;</a></sup> opposition activists and government critics have been <a href="/wiki/Misinformation_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic#Efforts_to_combat_misinformation" class="mw-redirect" title="Misinformation related to the COVID-19 pandemic">arrested</a> for allegedly spreading <a href="/wiki/Fake_news" title="Fake news">fake news</a> about the COVID-19 pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-20200410straitstimes_675-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200410straitstimes-675">&#91;667&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>In India, journalists criticising the government\'s response were arrested or issued warnings by police and authorities.<sup id="cite_ref-676" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-676">&#91;668&#93;</a></sup> Rates of imprisoned or detained journalists increased worldwide, with some being related to the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-677" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-677">&#91;669&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-678" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-678">&#91;670&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The government of the UK faced criticism after the now-former <a href="/wiki/Downing_Street_Chief_of_Staff" title="Downing Street Chief of Staff">Chief of Staff</a> <a href="/wiki/Dominic_Cummings" title="Dominic Cummings">Dominic Cummings</a> was <a href="/wiki/Dominic_Cummings_scandal" title="Dominic Cummings scandal">discovered multiple times breaking lockdown</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-679" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-679">&#91;671&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Agriculture_and_food_systems">Agriculture and food systems</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Food_security_during_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Food security during the COVID-19 pandemic">Food security during the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<p>The COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted agricultural and food systems worldwide.<sup id="cite_ref-:9_680-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:9-680">&#91;672&#93;</a></sup> COVID-19 hit at a time when hunger or undernourishment was once again on the rise in the world, with an estimated 690&#160;million people already going hungry in 2019.<sup id="cite_ref-:10_681-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:10-681">&#91;673&#93;</a></sup> Based on the latest UN estimates, the economic recession triggered by the pandemic may lead to another 83&#160;million people, and possibly as many as 132&#160;million, going hungry in 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-:10_681-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:10-681">&#91;673&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-M3hAF_682-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-M3hAF-682">&#91;674&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-6HCSA_683-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6HCSA-683">&#91;675&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-XRNlH_684-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-XRNlH-684">&#91;676&#93;</a></sup> This is mainly due to a lack of access to food \xe2\x80\x93 linked to falling incomes, lost remittances and, in some cases, a rise in food prices. In countries that already suffer from high levels of acute food insecurity, it is no longer an issue of access to food alone, but increasingly also one of food production.<sup id="cite_ref-:9_680-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:9-680">&#91;672&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-:10_681-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:10-681">&#91;673&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The pandemic, alongside lockdowns and travel restrictions, has prevented movement of aid and greatly impacted food production. As a result, several famines are forecast, which the UN called a crisis "of biblical proportions,"<sup id="cite_ref-Fiona_Harvey_Environment_685-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fiona_Harvey_Environment-685">&#91;677&#93;</a></sup> or "hunger pandemic."<sup id="cite_ref-aX3dG_686-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-aX3dG-686">&#91;678&#93;</a></sup> It is estimated that without intervention 30&#160;million people may die of hunger, with <a href="/wiki/Oxfam" title="Oxfam">Oxfam</a> reporting that "12,000 people per day could die from COVID-19 linked hunger" by the end of 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-:Oxfam_12000_687-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:Oxfam_12000-687">&#91;679&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Fiona_Harvey_Environment_685-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fiona_Harvey_Environment-685">&#91;677&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-M756t_688-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-M756t-688">&#91;680&#93;</a></sup>\nThis pandemic, in conjunction with the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%932021_locust_infestation" title="2019\xe2\x80\x932021 locust infestation">2019\xe2\x80\x932021 locust infestations</a> and several <a href="/wiki/Ongoing_armed_conflicts" class="mw-redirect" title="Ongoing armed conflicts">ongoing armed conflicts</a>, is predicted to form the worst series of famines since the <a href="/wiki/Great_Chinese_Famine" title="Great Chinese Famine">Great Chinese Famine</a>, affecting between 10 and 20 percent of the global population in some way.<sup id="cite_ref-drZJx_689-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-drZJx-689">&#91;681&#93;</a></sup>\n55 countries are reported to be at risk, with three dozen succumbing to crisis-level famines or above in the worst-case scenario.<sup id="cite_ref-UN_Food_Report_690-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-UN_Food_Report-690">&#91;682&#93;</a></sup> 265&#160;million people are forecast to be in famine conditions, an increase of 125&#160;million due to the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-:Oxfam_12000_687-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:Oxfam_12000-687">&#91;679&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Education">Education</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_education" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on education">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on education</a></div><div class="excerpt"><div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg/220px-%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="134" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg/330px-%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/01/%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg/440px-%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="609" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AA%D8%AD%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA_%D9%86%D9%87%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C_%D8%AF%D8%B1_%D8%B4%D8%B1%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B7_%DA%A9%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7_3470479.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Students take end-of-year exams in <a href="/wiki/Tabriz" title="Tabriz">Tabriz</a>, Iran, during the pandemic</div></div></div>\n<p>The pandemic has severely impacted educational systems globally. Most governments have temporarily closed educational institutions, with many switching to <a href="/wiki/Online_education" class="mw-redirect" title="Online education">online education</a>. As of 30 September 2020, approximately 1.077&#160;billion <a href="/wiki/Learning" title="Learning">learners</a> are currently affected due to school closures in response to the pandemic. According to UNICEF monitoring, 53 countries are currently implementing nationwide closures and 27 are implementing local closures, impacting about 61.6 percent of the world\'s student population. 72 countries\' schools are currently open.<sup id="cite_ref-ynkmU_691-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ynkmU-691">&#91;683&#93;</a></sup>\nSchool closures impact not only students, teachers, and families but have far-reaching economic and societal consequences. School closures in response to the pandemic have shed light on various social and economic issues, including <a href="/wiki/Student_debt" title="Student debt">student debt</a>, <a href="/wiki/Digital_learning" title="Digital learning">digital learning</a>, food insecurity, and <a href="/wiki/Homelessness" title="Homelessness">homelessness</a>, as well as access to <a href="/wiki/Child_care" title="Child care">childcare</a>, <a href="/wiki/Health_care" title="Health care">health care</a>, <a href="/wiki/Housing" title="Housing">housing</a>, <a href="/wiki/Internet" title="Internet">internet</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Disability_rights_movement" title="Disability rights movement">disability services</a>. The impact has been more severe for disadvantaged children and their families.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (November 2020)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup>\n</p><p>The Higher Education Policy Institute conducted a report which discovered that around 63% of students claimed that their mental health had been worsened as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, and alongside this 38% demonstrated satisfaction with the accessibility of mental health services. Despite this, the director for policy and advocacy at the institute has explained that it is still unclear as to how and when normality will resume for students regarding their education and living situation.<sup id="cite_ref-692" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-692">&#91;684&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n</div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_health_issues">Other health issues</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on other health issues">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on other health issues</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>The pandemic has had many impacts on global health beyond those caused by the COVID-19 disease itself. It has led to a reduction in hospital visits for other reasons. There have been 38 per cent fewer hospital visits for <a href="/wiki/Heart_attack" class="mw-redirect" title="Heart attack">heart attack</a> symptoms in the United States and 40 per cent fewer in Spain.<sup id="cite_ref-693" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-693">&#91;685&#93;</a></sup> The head of cardiology at the <a href="/wiki/University_of_Arizona" title="University of Arizona">University of Arizona</a> said, "My worry is some of these people are dying at home because they\'re too scared to go to the hospital."<sup id="cite_ref-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Stat_News,_with_serious_heart_symptoms_away,_April_23_694-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Stat_News,_with_serious_heart_symptoms_away,_April_23-694">&#91;686&#93;</a></sup> There is also concern that people with <a href="/wiki/Stroke" title="Stroke">strokes</a> and <a href="/wiki/Appendicitis" title="Appendicitis">appendicitis</a> are not seeking timely treatment.<sup id="cite_ref-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Stat_News,_with_serious_heart_symptoms_away,_April_23_694-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Stat_News,_with_serious_heart_symptoms_away,_April_23-694">&#91;686&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Shortages_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Shortages related to the COVID-19 pandemic">Shortages</a> of medical supplies have impacted people with various conditions.<sup id="cite_ref-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Atlantic_Shortages_695-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Atlantic_Shortages-695">&#91;687&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>In several countries there has been a marked reduction of spread of <a href="/wiki/Sexually_transmitted_infection" title="Sexually transmitted infection">sexually transmitted infections</a>, including <a href="/wiki/HIV/AIDS" title="HIV/AIDS">HIV/AIDS</a>, attributable to COVID-19 quarantines, social distancing measures, and recommendations to not engage in casual sex.<sup id="cite_ref-696" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-696">&#91;688&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-697" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-697">&#91;689&#93;</a></sup> Similarly, in some places, rates of transmission of <a href="/wiki/Influenza" title="Influenza">influenza</a> and other respiratory viruses significantly decreased during the pandemic.<sup id="cite_ref-698" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-698">&#91;690&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-699" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-699">&#91;691&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-700" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-700">&#91;692&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>The pandemic has also <a href="/wiki/Mental_health_during_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Mental health during the COVID-19 pandemic">negatively impacted mental health</a> globally, including increased <a href="/wiki/Loneliness" title="Loneliness">loneliness</a> resulting from social distancing<sup id="cite_ref-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Brooks26Feb2020_701-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_Brooks26Feb2020-701">&#91;693&#93;</a></sup> and depression and domestic violence from lockdowns.<sup id="cite_ref-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_98XVx_702-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_other_health_issues_98XVx-702">&#91;694&#93;</a></sup> As of June 2020, 40% of U.S. adults were experiencing adverse mental health symptoms, with 11% having seriously considered trying to kill themselves in the past month.<sup id="cite_ref-703" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-703">&#91;695&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\nPaying attention and taking measures to prevent mental health problems and post-traumatic stress syndrome, particularly in women, is already a need.<sup id="cite_ref-704" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-704">&#91;696&#93;</a></sup></div></div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Environment_and_climate">Environment and climate</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_the_environment" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the environment">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the environment</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Impact of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic on environmental issues and Earth\'s climate</div> \n<p class="mw-empty-elt">\n\n</p>\n<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:332px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png/330px-Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png" decoding="async" width="330" height="273" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png/495px-Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png/660px-Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png 2x" data-file-width="720" data-file-height="595" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Pollutant_Drops_in_wuhan_china_due_to_virus.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Images from the <a href="/wiki/NASA_Earth_Observatory" title="NASA Earth Observatory">NASA Earth Observatory</a> show a stark drop in pollution in <a href="/wiki/Wuhan" title="Wuhan">Wuhan</a>, when comparing <a href="/wiki/Nitrogen_dioxide" title="Nitrogen dioxide">NO<sub>2</sub></a> levels in early 2019 (top) and early 2020 (bottom).<sup id="cite_ref-705" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-705">&#91;697&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>\n<p>The worldwide disruption caused by the pandemic has resulted in numerous effects on the <a href="/wiki/Natural_environment" title="Natural environment">environment</a> and <a href="/wiki/Climate" title="Climate">climate</a>. The global reduction in modern human activity such as the considerable <a href="/wiki/Economic_impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic#Transportation" title="Economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic">decline in planned travel</a> was coined <a href="/wiki/Anthropause" title="Anthropause">anthropause</a> and has caused a large drop in <a href="/wiki/Air_pollution" title="Air pollution">air pollution</a> and <a href="/wiki/Water_pollution" title="Water pollution">water pollution</a> in many regions.<sup id="cite_ref-706" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-706">&#91;698&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-bbcOverview1_707-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bbcOverview1-707">&#91;699&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-708" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-708">&#91;700&#93;</a></sup> In China, <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_lockdown_in_Hubei" class="mw-redirect" title="COVID-19 lockdown in Hubei">lockdowns</a> and other measures resulted in a 25<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>percent reduction in <a href="/wiki/Greenhouse_gas" title="Greenhouse gas">carbon emissions</a> and<span class="nowrap">&#160;</span>50 percent reduction in nitrogen oxides emissions, which one <a href="/wiki/Earth_system_science" title="Earth system science">Earth systems</a> scientist estimated may have saved at least 77,000 lives over two months.<sup id="cite_ref-mdpi_709-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mdpi-709">&#91;701&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DIm4R_710-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DIm4R-710">&#91;702&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-GFEED_711-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GFEED-711">&#91;703&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-mcmahon_712-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-mcmahon-712">&#91;704&#93;</a></sup> Other positive effects on the environment include <a href="/wiki/Governance" title="Governance">governance</a>-system-controlled investments towards a <a href="/wiki/Energy_transition" title="Energy transition">sustainable energy transition</a> and other goals related to environmental protection such as the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>\'s seven-year \xe2\x82\xac1 trillion budget proposal and \xe2\x82\xac750 billion recovery plan "<a href="/wiki/Next_Generation_EU" title="Next Generation EU">Next Generation EU</a>" which seeks to reserve 25% of EU spending for climate-friendly expenditure.<sup id="cite_ref-713" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-713">&#91;705&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-714" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-714">&#91;706&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-715" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-715">&#91;707&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>However, the pandemic has also provided cover for illegal activities such as <a href="/wiki/Deforestation_of_the_Amazon_rainforest" title="Deforestation of the Amazon rainforest">deforestation of the Amazon rainforest</a> and <a href="/wiki/Poaching" title="Poaching">poaching</a> in Africa, hindered <a href="/wiki/Environmental_policy" title="Environmental policy">environmental diplomacy</a> efforts, and created <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_recession" title="COVID-19 recession">economic fallout</a> that some predict will slow investment in <a href="/wiki/Green_energy" class="mw-redirect" title="Green energy">green energy</a> technologies.<sup id="cite_ref-Poaching1_716-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Poaching1-716">&#91;708&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Poaching2_717-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Poaching2-717">&#91;709&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-UN_718-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-UN-718">&#91;710&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Amazon1_719-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Amazon1-719">&#91;711&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Amazon2_720-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Amazon2-720">&#91;712&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-9mMFi_721-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9mMFi-721">&#91;713&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n</div>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Xenophobia_and_racism">Xenophobia and racism</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Xenophobia_and_racism_related_to_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Xenophobia and racism related to the COVID-19 pandemic">Xenophobia and racism related to the COVID-19 pandemic</a></div>\n<p>Heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been documented around the world <a href="/wiki/Sinophobe" class="mw-redirect" title="Sinophobe">toward people of Chinese and East and Southeast Asian descent</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-251_722-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-251-722">&#91;714&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-zogcf_723-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-zogcf-723">&#91;715&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-8BY2Y_724-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8BY2Y-724">&#91;716&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-725" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-725">&#91;717&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-726" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-726">&#91;718&#93;</a></sup> Reports from February 2020 (when most confirmed cases were confined to China) documented racist sentiments expressed in groups worldwide about Chinese people \'deserving\' the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-bangkokpost1854094_727-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bangkokpost1854094-727">&#91;719&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-psychologytoday202002_728-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-psychologytoday202002-728">&#91;720&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200201telegraph_729-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200201telegraph-729">&#91;721&#93;</a></sup> Chinese people and other Asian peoples in the United Kingdom and United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse and assaults.<sup id="cite_ref-NYT_Racism_730-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NYT_Racism-730">&#91;722&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-05O7n_731-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-05O7n-731">&#91;723&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-NYT_April_Racism_732-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NYT_April_Racism-732">&#91;724&#93;</a></sup> Former U.S. President Donald Trump was criticised for referring to the COVID-19 as the "Chinese Virus" and "Kung Flu", which has been condemned as racist and xenophobic.<sup id="cite_ref-trumpnyt_733-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-trumpnyt-733">&#91;725&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200320BI_734-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200320BI-734">&#91;726&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-MNCw4_735-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MNCw4-735">&#91;727&#93;</a></sup> On 14 March, an Asian family, including a two-year-old girl, was attacked at knifepoint in <a href="/wiki/Texas" title="Texas">Texas</a> in what the <a href="/wiki/FBI" class="mw-redirect" title="FBI">FBI</a> has called a COVID-19 related hate crime.<sup id="cite_ref-HUjOo_736-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HUjOo-736">&#91;728&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy (the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19) were also subjected to suspicion and xenophobia,<sup id="cite_ref-iOyUQ_737-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iOyUQ-737">&#91;729&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-FFsxo_738-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FFsxo-738">&#91;730&#93;</a></sup> as were people from hotspots in other countries. Discrimination against <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_India" title="Islam in India">Muslims in India</a> escalated after public health authorities identified an Islamic missionary (<a href="/wiki/Tablighi_Jamaat" title="Tablighi Jamaat">Tablighi Jamaat</a>) group\'s gathering in New Delhi in early March 2020 as a source of spread.<sup id="cite_ref-20200409slate_739-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200409slate-739">&#91;731&#93;</a></sup> As of late April 2020, Paris had seen riots break out over police <a href="/wiki/Social_situation_in_the_French_suburbs" title="Social situation in the French suburbs">treatment of marginalised ethnic groups</a> during the then in-place lockdown.<sup id="cite_ref-france2420200421_740-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-france2420200421-740">&#91;732&#93;</a></sup> Racism and xenophobia towards <a href="/wiki/South_Asian_ethnic_groups" title="South Asian ethnic groups">South Asian</a> groups increased in the <a href="/wiki/Arab_states_of_the_Persian_Gulf" title="Arab states of the Persian Gulf">Arab states of the Persian Gulf</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-20200512hrw_741-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200512hrw-741">&#91;733&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20200417trtworld_742-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200417trtworld-742">&#91;734&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-dmHvo_743-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-dmHvo-743">&#91;735&#93;</a></sup> South Korea\'s <a href="/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_South_Korea" title="LGBT rights in South Korea">LGBTQ community</a> was blamed by some for the spread of COVID-19 in Seoul.<sup id="cite_ref-20200513hrw_744-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20200513hrw-744">&#91;736&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-indianexpress6415370_745-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-indianexpress6415370-745">&#91;737&#93;</a></sup> In China, some <a href="/wiki/Africans_in_Guangzhou#COVID-19_pandemic" title="Africans in Guangzhou">people of African descent</a>  were evicted from their homes and told to leave China within 24 hours, due to disinformation that they and other foreigners were spreading the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-qz1836510_746-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-qz1836510-746">&#91;738&#93;</a></sup> This policy was criticised by some foreign governments, diplomatic corps, and the Chinese ambassador to Zimbabwe.<sup id="cite_ref-ZAYBk_747-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ZAYBk-747">&#91;739&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Lifestyle_change_adaptation_during_the_pandemic">Lifestyle change adaptation during the pandemic</span></h3>\n<p>The pandemic has resulted in many people adapting to massive changes in life, from increased internet commerce activity to the job market. Social distancing has caused increased sales from large e-commerce companies such as <a href="/wiki/Amazon_(company)" title="Amazon (company)">Amazon</a>, <a href="/wiki/Alibaba_Group" title="Alibaba Group">Alibaba</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Coupang" title="Coupang">Coupang</a>. Online retailers in the US posted 791.70 billion dollars in sales in 2020, an increase of 32.4% from 598.02 billion dollars from the year before.<sup id="cite_ref-DDCV1ECMR_748-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DDCV1ECMR-748">&#91;740&#93;</a></sup> The trend of home delivery orders have increased due to the pandemic, with indoor dining restaurants shutting down due to lockdown orders or low sales.<sup id="cite_ref-Fo18zrty783_749-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fo18zrty783-749">&#91;741&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Fo18zrty784_750-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fo18zrty784-750">&#91;742&#93;</a></sup> Hackers and cybercriminals/scammers have started targeting people due to the massive changes, with some pretending to be part of the CDC, and others using different phishing schemes.<sup id="cite_ref-Fo18zrty787_751-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fo18zrty787-751">&#91;743&#93;</a></sup> Education worldwide has increasingly shifted from physical attendance to video conferencing apps such as Zoom as lockdown measures have resulted in schools being forced to shut down.<sup id="cite_ref-Fo18zrty790_752-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fo18zrty790-752">&#91;744&#93;</a></sup> Due to the pandemic, mass layoffs have occurred in the airline, travel, hospitality, and some other industries. (There is no sign of a permanent recovery as of March 2021<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=COVID-19_pandemic&amp;action=edit">&#91;update&#93;</a></sup>.)<sup id="cite_ref-Fo18zrty6966_753-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fo18zrty6966-753">&#91;745&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Fo18zrty9999_754-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Fo18zrty9999-754">&#91;746&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Information_dissemination">Information dissemination</span></h2>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Media_coverage_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Media coverage of the COVID-19 pandemic">Media coverage of the COVID-19 pandemic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_social_media" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on social media">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on social media</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_journalism" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on journalism">Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on journalism</a></div>\n<p>Ongoing COVID-19 research is indexed and searchable in the <a href="/wiki/NIH" class="mw-redirect" title="NIH">NIH</a> COVID-19 Portfolio.<sup id="cite_ref-Zygy7_755-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Zygy7-755">&#91;747&#93;</a></sup> Some newspaper agencies removed their online <a href="/wiki/Paywall" title="Paywall">paywalls</a> for some or all of their COVID-19-related articles and posts,<sup id="cite_ref-Paywalls_756-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Paywalls-756">&#91;748&#93;</a></sup> while scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with <a href="/wiki/Open_access" title="Open access">open access</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-255_757-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-255-757">&#91;749&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Aristovnik_et_al._2020_758-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Aristovnik_et_al._2020-758">&#91;750&#93;</a></sup> Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on <a href="/wiki/Preprint" title="Preprint">preprint</a> servers such as <a href="/wiki/BioRxiv" title="BioRxiv">bioRxiv</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-AutoDW-256_759-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-AutoDW-256-759">&#91;751&#93;</a></sup>\n</p><p>Maps have played a key role in disseminating information concerning the spatial distribution of the disease, especially with the development of dashboards to present data in near real-time. Methods of data visualisation have drawn some criticism, however, in the over-simplification of geographical patterns indicated by choropleth maps that adopt national, rather than local, map scales.<sup id="cite_ref-760" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-760">&#91;752&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\n<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Misinformation"><span class="anchor" id="Disinformation"></span> Misinformation</span></h3>\n<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_misinformation" title="COVID-19 misinformation">COVID-19 misinformation</a></div>\n<div class="excerpt-block"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r952607947"/><div class="excerpt">\n<p>The COVID-19 pandemic has resulted in <a href="/wiki/Misinformation" title="Misinformation">misinformation</a> and <a href="/wiki/Conspiracy_theory" title="Conspiracy theory">conspiracy theories</a> about the scale of the pandemic and the <a href="/wiki/Investigations_into_the_origin_of_COVID-19" title="Investigations into the origin of COVID-19">origin</a>, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of <a href="/wiki/Coronavirus_disease_2019" class="mw-redirect" title="Coronavirus disease 2019">the disease</a>. False information, including intentional <a href="/wiki/Disinformation" title="Disinformation">disinformation</a>, has been <a href="/wiki/Impact_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic_on_social_media#Misinformation" title="Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on social media">spread through social media</a>, text messaging,<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_misinformation_FTTextMsg_761-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_misinformation_FTTextMsg-761">&#91;753&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Media_coverage_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Media coverage of the COVID-19 pandemic">mass media</a>. Journalists have been arrested for allegedly spreading <a href="/wiki/Fake_news" title="Fake news">fake news</a> about the pandemic. False information has also been propagated by celebrities, politicians, and other prominent public figures. The spread of <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_misinformation_by_governments" title="COVID-19 misinformation by governments">COVID-19 misinformation by governments</a> has also been significant.\n</p><p>Commercial <a href="/wiki/Confidence_trick" title="Confidence trick">scams</a> have claimed to offer <a href="/wiki/List_of_unproven_methods_against_COVID-19" title="List of unproven methods against COVID-19">at-home tests, supposed preventives, and "miracle" cures</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-762" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-762">&#91;754&#93;</a></sup> Several religious groups have claimed their faith will protect them from the virus.<sup id="cite_ref-763" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-763">&#91;755&#93;</a></sup> Without evidence, some people have claimed the virus is a <a href="/wiki/Bioweapon" class="mw-redirect" title="Bioweapon">bioweapon</a> accidentally or purposefully leaked from a laboratory, a <a href="/wiki/Human_population_planning" title="Human population planning">population control</a> scheme, the result of a <a href="/wiki/Espionage" title="Espionage">spy operation</a>, or the side effect of <a href="/wiki/5G" title="5G">5G</a> upgrades to cellular networks.<sup id="cite_ref-764" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-764">&#91;756&#93;</a></sup>\n</p>\nThe <a href="/wiki/World_Health_Organization" title="World Health Organization">World Health Organization</a> (WHO) declared an "infodemic" of incorrect information about the virus that poses risks to global health.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_misinformation_Lowy_765-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_misinformation_Lowy-765">&#91;757&#93;</a></sup> While belief in conspiracy theories is not a new phenomenon, in the context of the coronavirus pandemic, this can lead to adverse health effects. Cognitive biases, such as jumping to conclusions and confirmation bias, may be linked to the occurrence of conspiracy beliefs.<sup id="cite_ref-766" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-766">&#91;758&#93;</a></sup></div></div>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span></h2>\n<div style="float:right;"><br /></div>\n<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Emerging_infectious_disease" title="Emerging infectious disease">Emerging infectious disease</a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Globalisation_and_disease" class="mw-redirect" title="Globalisation and disease">Globalisation and disease</a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/List_of_epidemics_and_pandemics" class="mw-redirect" title="List of epidemics and pandemics">List of epidemics and pandemics</a></li>\n<li><a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_the_COVID-19_pandemic" title="Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic">Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic</a></li></ul>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>\n<div style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;"><div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">\n<li id="cite_note-fn1-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-fn1_1-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In summary, this article is about the coronavirus <i>pandemic</i>, which is caused by the <i>disease</i> COVID-19, which in turn is caused by the <i>virus</i> SARS\xe2\x80\x91CoV\xe2\x80\x912.</span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"Close contact" is variously defined, including as being within ~1.8 metres (six feet) and face to face for a cumulative total of 15 minutes by the US <a href="/wiki/Centers_for_Disease_Control_and_Prevention" title="Centers for Disease Control and Prevention">Centers for Disease Control and Prevention</a> (CDC)<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup> or as either having 15 minutes of face-to-face proximity or sharing an enclosed space for a prolonged period such as two hours by the Australian Health Department.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-CDCTrans_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CDCTrans-8">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-97"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-97">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">This CDC best estimate (current as of 10 September) was derived from a paper in PLOS Medicine that estimated a range of IFR across several areas in Europe, from 0.5% (95% CrI 0.4%\xe2\x80\x930.6%) in Switzerland to 1.4% (95% CrI 1.1%\xe2\x80\x931.6%) in Lombardy, Italy (based on data through mid-to-late April).<sup id="cite_ref-Hauser_2020_79-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hauser_2020-79">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup> Regarding the differences across the regions, the European researchers noted "the importance of local factors ... including demographic characteristics" and "the lower degree of preparedness and health service capacity in northern Italy, which in Europe was affected first by the SARS-CoV-2 epidemic."<sup id="cite_ref-Hauser_2020_79-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Hauser_2020-79">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-98"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-98">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The overall value was corrected from 0.27% to account for "the fact that only one or two types of antibodies (among IgG, IgM, IgA) might have been used" in testing.</span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-103"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-103">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">One set of national statistics for England (<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/healthandsocialcare/conditionsanddiseases/datasets/coronaviruscovid19infectionsurveydata">ONS</a>) shows a decrease in IFR from 2.63% to 0.49%; another (<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.mrc-bsu.cam.ac.uk/now-casting">MRC</a>) from 0.69% to 0.30%, both over eight weeks ending 4 August.</span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-108"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-108">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Some refer to \'fatality rate\'; however \'fatality ratio\' is more accurate as this is not per unit time.<sup id="cite_ref-WHOest_81-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WHOest-81">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-480"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-480">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">A lack of mass testing obscured the extent of the outbreak.<sup id="cite_ref-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_WhoriskeyMarch16_479-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COVID-19_pandemic_in_the_United_States_WhoriskeyMarch16-479">&#91;473&#93;</a></sup></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-482"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-482">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The earliest deaths were not known to be caused by COVID-19 until April.</span>\n</li>\n</ol></div></div>\n<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>\n<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output ao%2C+Liang&amp;rft.au=Ye%2C+Zhikang&amp;rft.au=Guyatt%2C+Gordon+H&amp;rft.au=Brignardello-Petersen%2C+Romina&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC7390912&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACOVID-19+pandemic" href="#cite_ref-Lancet2020Flatten_189-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Lancet2020Flatten_189-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Lancet2020Flatten_189-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"/><cite id="CITEREFAndersonHeesterbeekKlinkenbergHollingsworth2020" class="citation journal cs1">Anderson RM, Heesterbeek H, Klinkenberg D, Hollingsworth TD (March 2020). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7158572">"How will country-based mitigation measures influence the course of the COVID-19 epidemic?"</a>. <i>Lancet</i>. <b>395</b> (10228): 931\xe2\x80\x93934. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2FS0140-6736%2820%2930567-5">10.1016/S0140-6736(20)30567-5</a>. <a href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a>&#160;<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7158572">7158572</a></span>. <a href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a>&#160;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32164834">32164834</a>. <q>A key issue for epidemiologists is helping policy makers decide the main objectives of mitigation\xe2\x80\x94e.g. minimising morbidity and associated mortality, avoiding an epidemic peak that overwhelms health-care services, keeping the effects on the economy within manageable levels, and flattening the epidemic curve to wait for vaccine development and manufacture on scale and antiviral drug therapies.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Lancet&amp;rft.atitle=How+will+country-based+mitigation+measures+influence+the+course+of+the+COVID-19+epidemic%3F&amp;rft.volume=395&amp;rft.issue=10228&amp;rft.pages=931-934&amp;rft.date=2020-03&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC7158572%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F32164834&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1016%2FS0140-6736%2820%2930567-5&amp;rft.aulast=Anderson&amp;rft.aufirst=RM&amp;rft.au=Heesterbeek%2C+H&amp;rft.au=Klinkenberg%2C+D&amp;rft.au=Hollingsworth%2C+TD&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC7158572&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ACOVID-19+pandemic" class="Z3988"></span></span>\n</li>\n<li id="cite_note-RnW59-190"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-RnW59_190-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link
